position: Secure and Assured Software Graduate Student Intern
description:
Full Job Description
Overview

Draper is an independent, nonprofit research and development company headquartered in Cambridge, MA. The 1,800 employees of Draper tackle important national challenges with a promise of delivering successful and usable solutions. From military defense and space exploration to biomedical engineering, lives often depend on the solutions we provide. Our multidisciplinary teams of engineers and scientists work in a collaborative environment that inspires the cross-fertilization of ideas necessary for true innovation. For more information about Draper, visit www.draper.com.

Our work is very important to us, but so is our life outside of work. Draper supports many programs to improve work-life balance including workplace flexibility, employee clubs ranging from photography to yoga, health and finance workshops, off site social events and discounts to local museums and cultural activities. If this specific job opportunity and the chance to work at a nationally renowned R&D innovation company appeals to you, apply now www.draper.com/careers.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Draper is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. We understand the value of diversity and its impact on a high-performance culture. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information.

Draper is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. To request reasonable accommodation, please contact hr@draper.com.

Responsibilities

The students selected to work in the Secure and Assured Software Cyber groups will perform software engineering tasks in support of the development and testing of program analysis, cyber security, and formal verification technologies. Automated Binary Analysis
Formal Verification
Compilers
Cyber Resilience Technologies
Reverse Engineering
Cyber Security Tool Development (Static & Dynamic Analysis)
Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

Student should provide evidence of high aptitude and academic performance.

Depending on the specific project assignment, the skills that are helpful for many in this area may include those listed below. Students are not expected to have every skill listed.

Strong functional programming skills
Strong C / C++ skills
Experience with static program analysis

Our goal is to build a roadmap that leads you to a long, rewarding and challenging career with Perspecta. What matters to our nation, is what matters to us. Full Job Description
US-IA-Des Moines

Req No. 2021-7301
Category Internship
Type Intern

The Opportunity

We are seeking a talented IT Quality Assurance Analyst Intern to carry out basic quality assurance processes; assist in developing test plans and test cases from functional specifications and business requirements, executing test cases, tracking software defects and verifying the software fixes. This includes unit, integration, system, regression and UAT. This role partners closely with other QA members, business analysts, software development and the stakeholders of the business. It is essential to ensuring on-time and on-budget delivery of new and enhanced business capabilities that meet or exceed expectations.

What You Can Look Forward to

Work closely with analysts, developers and engineers to assist writing test plans, estimates and schedules to support project and product releases.
Assist in developing Test Plans and test cases from Functional specifications and business requirements.
Executing Test Cases that follow best practice standards (manual) producing documented results that determine the release readiness of products or features.
Assist in troubleshooting of quality issues.
Actively Supports culture and leadership practices.
Proactively pursues development opportunities and show expected progress on learning plan.
Utilize templates, tools, metrics and best practices to verify that products meet business and user requirements.
Communicate consistently and effectively with internal business partners to understand appropriate business requirements.
Partners with business and IT to support testing for releases.
Ensure there is an understanding of work effort, timelines and expectations.
Actively supports our CO-OP culture and embraces our core values of Work as Partners, Communicate Openly and Honestly, Demonstrate Excellence and Champion Change in all interactions.

What You'll Need to Succeed

12 completed semester hours at college or university, preferably in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or equivalent.
3.0 Cumulative GPA.
Previous internship and/or work experience preferred.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
The ability to work as part of a team demonstrated through involvement with student organizations, community involvement, work experience, or other activities.
Possess high motivation and self-direction, sound problem solving skills, decision making and multi- tasking skills.
Ability to think analytically to solve problems individually and in a team environment.
Ability to listen, understand, and respond to external and internal customers' needs in a timely manner.

Why Join CO-OP?

CO-OP is committed to fostering a workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and connected. We are dedicated to understanding, attracting and engaging a diverse workforce where every employee can live up to their pull potential; ensuring that our employee base reflects the consumers we serve. The result of this effort is an inclusive environment where diverse talent thrives. You will be part of an organization that focuses on a strong culture and embodies the credit union movement philosophy of People Helping People. CO-OP's commitment to reflecting our own core values and purpose extends beyond how we serve our clients and the products that we deliver.

With more than 35 years of industry leadership, CO-OP Financial Services is the largest, most comprehensive credit union service organization in the nation. CO-OP serves as THE credit union technology engine, bringing payments solutions, engagement services and strategic counsel to help credit unions optimize member experiences to consistently provide seamless, personalized multi-channel offerings, while delivering secure, sophisticated fraud mitigation service.

CO-OP serves more than 3,000 client credit unions, with 60 million debit and credit cardholders, nearly 30,000 surcharge-free ATMs and more than 5,600 shared branches nationwide. position: Exciting iOS Internship at Sports AI Startup
description:
Full Job Description

Want to pick up iOS development skills (one of the most in-demand skills in the job market)?

Ready to gain experience in Artificial Intelligence and open up new markets?

We are offering a bright, talented CS student the opportunity to learn how to develop iOS Apps through both online coursework and working directly with the creator of a 4.5 star rated iPhone App.

“iOS developers are among the top 10 most in-demand and hardest to fill tech jobs” - Indeed.

Sparrow is an early-stage startup that uses artificial intelligence (AI) to help athletes improve.

In this 8 month internship, you’ll work closely with Sparrow’s founders and core tech team on the production ready version of our app, learning the ins and outs of the startup, A.I., and sports worlds.

At Sparrow you will:

  • Work on an sports app that uses cutting-edge technology, including A.I., augmented reality, computer vision, and animation
  • Take things from concept to app
  • Be involved in all aspects of app development (unit testing, UI projects)
  • And much more!

The internship will involve:

  • Online coursework at AppCoda, Udemy, etc. to pick up the basics of iOS development
  • Alongside the coursework, you will receive on-the-job training from our experienced development team
  • As you gain proficiency and knowledge, you will become a contributor to the overall development process

Person sought must:

  • Be a student or masters student at a reputable college, with a computer science degree
  • Be able to work an 8 hour work day (-40 hours per week) January through August
  • Have strong CS fundamentals and problem solving skills
  • Be uber-productive, able to switch between different kinds of tasks, and comfortable taking on all jobs complex or mundane.
  • Be excited to learn iOS development (Swift)
  • Be very detail-oriented and thoughtful when executing a task or initiative
  • Be able to figure out how things work, or how to get things done when a solution isn’t obvious or involves multiple steps or tools

This position represents a unique opportunity to:

  • Work closely with the company founders, successful serial entrepreneurs who have started numerous companies, raised over $20 million in venture capital for them, and have 2 successful exits. (check out our founders here: https://youtu.be/r82gufgzltg)
  • Learn the ins-and-outs of running a startup with tremendous potential that is just getting started
  • Receive a $50 weekly stipend, college credit and potentially earn an equity bonus (stock options), and more importantly gain relationships in the tech, AI, and sports industry

position: PhD Intern - Network Science and Machine Learning
description:
Full Job Description
Organization and Job ID

Job ID: 311872

Directorate: National Security

Division: Computing & Analytics

Group:Applied Statistics & Computational Modeling

Job Description

This position is for a student internship in Applied Network Science. Operating on the data-information-knowledge continuum, staff at PNNL employ diverse methods to confront significant problems of national interest – from distilling distributed data into knowledge that supports decision processes to enabling resilient technologies that enhance computing at extreme scales. This internship will involve designing new methods, implementing algorithms, and analyzing data that can be represented as a network. Examples of such data include citation networks, cyber systems, social networks, and many more.

The intern will work with computing researchers and practitioners to apply advanced theories, methods, algorithms, models, evaluation tools and testbeds, and computational-based solutions to address complex scientific challenges affecting energy, biological sciences, the environment, and national security. Initial studies will be around collaboration networks and influence identification. Familiarity with time-dynamic systems is also important.

Minimum Qualifications

Candidates must be currently enrolled/matriculated in a PhD program at an accredited college. Minimum GPA of 3.0 is required.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in python, C/C++/C# or java programming is preferred, but not required.

Familiarity with techniques from graph theory (network science) and machine learning.

Preferred Education

Candidates must be currently enrolled in a Ph.D. program in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science or related field and must have a proven research track record including publications. Cumulative GPA of 3.5 or higher preferred.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Battelle Memorial Institute (BMI) at Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and supports diversity in the workplace. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital or family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetic information. All BMI staff must be able to demonstrate the legal right to work in the United States. BMI is an E-Verify employer. Learn more at jobs.pnnl.gov.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via https://jobs.pnnl.gov/help.stm

Please be aware that the Department of Energy (DOE) prohibits DOE employees and contractors from having any affiliation with the foreign government of a country DOE has identified as a “country of risk” without explicit approval by DOE and Battelle. If you are offered a position at PNNL and currently have any affiliation with the government of one of these countries you will be required to disclose this information and recuse yourself of that affiliation or receive approval from DOE and Battelle prior to your first day of employment.

position: Physics/ Science/ Mechanical Engineering – Summer Intern – DOD Programs
description:
Full Job Description
Peraton is seeking a Physics/Science/Mechanical Engineering Summer Intern to support our U.S. Navy Strategic Programs in Colorado Springs, Colorado.

For more than 60 years, Peraton has supported the U.S. Navy by performing research, development, analysis, modeling and simulation, test and evaluation to assess weapon system performance and qualify weapon systems for normal and hostile environments.

As an Intern, you will join the project team to learn and provide technical support for our ongoing, fast-paced, hypersonic research, development, test and evaluation efforts. You will have the opportunity to use commercial software and Peraton-developed software simulation tools to support and deliver timely analysis results for the U.S. Navy.
Assist Physicists, Engineers, and Software Developers in technical work pertinent to the team to which you are assigned
Support a team in the completion of materials characterization testing and qualification for use in hostile and atmospheric reentry environments

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:
A High School diploma and are entering your junior or senior year as a student pursuing a BS in Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics at an accredited university offering a 4-year degree program
Experience with MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, and MS Word
Academic experience with any of: Python, MatLab, C++
Ability to obtain a DOD security clearance, which requires a U.S. citizen

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
A GPA of 3.0 or higher
Basic hardware and software hands-on development experience
Basic system integration and testing experience
Strong written and verbal communication skills Ability to be detail-oriented and to prioritize work and meet quick turnaround deadlines

Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act:
The yearly compensation range for this role is: Minimum - $29,299 to Maximum - $45,780.
The successful candidate will be offered a yearly compensation that aligns with their individual skills and experience as it directly relates to the position requirements.
In addition to the yearly salary, Peraton provides a variety of benefits to include: health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).
Peraton drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world’s leading mission capability integrator, we are a trusted provider of highly differentiated national security solutions and technologies that keep people safe and secure. Peraton serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies, including the Intelligence Community, Department of Defense, Department of Health and Human Services, and NASA. Every day, our 10,000 employees do the can’t be done, solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers.
We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state, or local law.

Full Job Description
Company Description

Tesseract's mission is to democratize healthcare delivery to everyone around the world. We are reinventing medical devices and championing a new era of healthcare by creating a portable, affordable device for monitoring and preventing disease. This breakthrough optic technology reinforces that the eye is a window into the human body.

Tesseract is a well-funded, rapidly growing health-tech incubator founded by award-winning scientist and highly successful serial entrepreneur, Dr. Jonathan Rothberg. Tesseract benefits from being a 4Catalyzer company, an incubator of health-tech companies (most notably Butterfly Network) who has raised over $700 million in funding.

Joining Tesseract is the opportunity to redesign the future of healthcare through the power of technology. Embark on a journey with us to maximize global impact, motivated by the idea that our products will change the lives of millions along with the people you love.

Job Description

Tesseract is looking for a local summer intern to help in their engineering department. This internship has the potential to be extended beyond the summer

As part of our team, your core responsibilities will be:
Research and suggest state of the art ML algorithms and tools
Select appropriate datasets and features to build models according to requirements
Build, train and validate machine learning solutions for the prediction of ocular diseases using retinal imaging data
Qualifications

Baseline skills/experiences/attributes:
BS, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence or related technical field with a strong background in theory and practice
Proficiency in general purpose programming languages, in particular Python and basic libraries for machine learning such as Scikit-Learn and Pandas
Knowledge and experience with AWS ML and supporting services, cloud computing and Kubernetes
Knowledge of machine learning frameworks: Tensorflow, Pytorch, Keras, Scikit-Learn
Must possess excellent communication skills both verbal and written.

You Deeply Identify with Core Tesseract Values:
Efficient & Speedy - you get work done in a fraction of the time as industry peers
Intellectually Curious - you are thoughtful & inquisitive; people enjoy working with you because they learn from you
Mission-Driven & Committed - you are passionate about the company's purpose and are immensely productive
Team Oriented - you celebrate and take joy in the success of others on the team
Additional Information

We offer great perks:
Competitive salaried compensation - we value our employees and show it
Free onsite meals + kitchen stocked with snacks.
Beautiful office overlooking the Flatiron building in NYC
The opportunity to build a revolutionary healthcare product and save millions of lives!

Tesseract is an equal opportunity employer regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or Veteran status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

BioPier is looking for Biostatistical Programming Interns. The internship program provides training for vital SAS programming skills required to analyze and report Phase I-IV clinical trial studies.

The intern start date is flexible. The duration will be 3 months working 40 hours per week. Upon completing the internship, we will evaluate interns for a full-time job as Biostatistical Analyst or Biostatistician.

Due to COVID-19, all open positions are currently remote. When our office resumes operation, we may ask you to work from our office in Burlington, MA.

Interns will be working with experienced biostatistical consultants on the following tasks:

§ Write SAS programs to perform data analysis for drug efficacy and safety, and produce statistical tables, listings, and figures to implement statistical analysis plan;

§ Daily tasks include understanding clinical study protocol and statistical analysis plan, standardizing clinical study data for CDISC compliance, writing SAS programs and macro for datasets and reports;

§ Double program to validate the accuracy of study programs and analysis datasets;

§ SAS Advanced Programming Certification is strongly preferred;

§ High GPA, hardworking, strong attention to detail, motivated to pursue a career in biostatistical programming;

Full Job Description

SUMMER INTERN, IT SOFTWARE DEVELOPER

WHO WE ARE

DeMarche Associates, Inc. is a leading institutional financial research, investment consulting and investment management firm. Founded in 1974, DeMarche offers an array of services designed to help institutional trustees manage their organization’s endowments, pensions and private funds.

WHAT WE NEED

DeMarche is transitioning its proprietary legacy software from old code to new code. This presents an opportunity for an individual to acquire coding experience in a corporate environment while experiencing best practices in industry change management and testing protocols. The opportunity is an interim 9-week internship under the guidance and supervision of the firm’s lead programmer.

ABOUT THE INTERN OPPORTUNITY

This is a paid full-time internship that will run consecutively for 9 weeks beginning June 1, 2021 and concluding July 30, 2021. Compensation is $15 per hour, non-negotiable. All work is done between the core hours of 8:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. CT, Monday through Friday, in our Merriam corporate office located two blocks east of Interstate 35.

You must be a local candidate with residential accommodations in the Kansas City metro area. Preference is given to students nearing the end of their academic experience with declared majors in computer science from accredited colleges or technology programs. Consideration may be given to candidates with other business or technology degrees who have substantial work experience coding.

COVID safety practices are enforced in the office. This is not a remote position. Interns are not eligible for travel reimbursement, company benefits, housing, relocation or work sponsorship.

WHAT YOU WILL DO

  • Code and test programming for software.
  • Execute code builds to test in production environments.
  • Fix bugs in new code.
  • Maintain documentation according to coding best practices.

WHAT IS NEEDED FROM YOU FOR SUCCESS

Capabilities:

  • Ability to write clean, well-documented code and support documentation
  • Excellent complex problem solving skills
  • Solid troubleshooting and effective communication skills
  • Demonstrated analytical and critical thinking abilities
  • A track record of efficient, complete work with a sensitivity to timeliness
  • Meticulous attention to detail and editing
  • Demonstration of if/then logical, linear thinking
  • Ability for sustained, concentrated effort for high productivity and efficiency
  • Ability to follow directions accurately and to work with minimal daily supervision

Education and Experience Requirements:

  • Highly preferred:
  • Candidate is working toward an Associate’s degree or Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field
  • Required and necessary:
  • One or more years of coding experience
  • Strong experience with all languages: C#, REST, JAVA
  • Plus, hands-on experience with at least one: HTML5, CSS3, or JavaScript or Microsoft SQL Server

HOW TO APPLY

Qualified applicants: Apply with a detailed resume. Initial screening interviews are conducted by telephone. Follow-up interviews with finalists are by invitation only and will occur virtually.

Our platform centralizes a very large and fragmented market and provides travelers a tool to search for, compare, and book tours and activities. Our machine learning algorithms recommend tours with high affinity to our users based on their travel interests.

Job Description:
Leidos is seeking a talented Data Science Intern, located in our Arlington, VA office.

This position is for an intern to provide research and data science support to Leidos sustainability efforts. The candidate should be familiar with at least one programming language, ideally Python. Additionally, the candidate should have experience with data processing to include collecting, parsing, transforming, visualizing, and analyzing data. Experience with at least one of the following machine learning libraries SciKit Learn, Keras, TensorFlow, or PyTorch is a plus. The candidate must be intellectually adaptive, inquisitive, good at expressing their needs, and self-managed when necessary. Selected candidates will work alongside software/system engineers and research/data scientists with expertise in multi-modal information retrieval, UI development, computer vision, metrics, information science, artificial intelligence, and autonomous systems.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Research sustainability industry standards
  • Identify relevant sustainability datasets
  • Process relevant sustainability data including scraping, ETL processing, and cleaning
  • Perform exploratory data analysis using jupyter notebooks
  • Recommend and apply further data processing techniques such as Machine Learning (ML) services as necessary to enhance the data and automate the data collection process.
  • Deliver research and analysis as jupyter notebooks with visualizations, code, and documentation
  • Present research directly to the Sustainability Working Group (SWG)
  • Attend meetings as required
  • Manage and deliver code and documentation via git as required
Basic Qualifications

  • Pursuing a Degree in Aerospace Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or related fields
  • Must be eligible to obtain a DoD Top Secret security clearance with polygraph
  • U.S. Citizenship required
  • Practical experience with statistical analysis
  • Intermediate software development skills including developing and maintaining code bases
  • Hands-on Software Development Skills (Python-Preferred)
  • Experience or educational courses/projects in Machine Learning, and/or Text
Preferred Qualifications

  • Visualizations/Web Development Skills (e.g. Tableau, D3, etc)
  • Hands-on experience with prototype development
  • Hands-on experience with automating data cleansing, formatting, staging, and transforming data human
  • Hands-on experience applying data analytics
  • Hands-on experience with intelligent systems and machine learning
  • Experience with interpretability of deep learning models
  • Big Data Skills (Azure, Hadoop, Spark, recent deep learning platforms)
  • Experience with text mining tools and techniques including in areas of summarization, search (e.g. elasticsearch), entity extraction, training set generation (e.g. Snorkel) and anomaly detection

Ineligible

GTRI’s Cooperative Education (“co-op”) program offers you extensive opportunities to participate in diverse scientific and technological endeavors, use state-of-the-art equipment and rapidly improve your technical and leadership skills. Hendrick Motorsports, a leading NASCAR Motorsports operation, is currently seeking a highly motivated engineering student for the Competition Systems Group. The ideal candidate is expected to have solid basic knowledge on vehicle dynamics, vehicle subsystems, simulation, tire performance, modeling, testing and deliverables. Also, the candidate will participate in the development and operation of a simulator. The development work for the simulator will include but it is not limited to audio, visual system, and software development. Other characteristics are to have the ability to work in a collaborative environment, developing and validating simulation software to improve overall vehicle performance on the track.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTION(S):
Driving Simulator

Execute development projects to improve and enhance the functionality and performance of simulator
Support the development of the driving simulator from an operational perspective
Maintain simulator software and hardware where appropriate
Contribute to the operation and reliability of the simulator sessions including assisting with fault diagnosis and problem solving, sometimes under pressure
Working with drivers and/or engineers to improve performance through driving or setup and setting changes
Work withing the team to collectively develop the engineering capability and knowledge of the team
Record Driver comments for each run
Analyze data after each run, compare to track data or previous test data for correlation and effect of change
Create inputs for DiL with direction from teams, Post-Race, Pre-Race, Test Prep
Help validate new models / inputs such as aero maps and engine files

Race Team Support

Creation of basic tools to support race day activities
Assist with Pre and Post Event Reports
Support race day team activities

SKILLS & ABILITIES

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program:
The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:
1. Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.

About the team:
Welcome to the Human Revolution! Join a company that can bootstrap your career, accelerate your development, and recognize and reward your contributions.

For every company, people are their most important asset. SAP SuccessFactors is the platform that empowers employees to perform at their best, and for the business to streamline the way they handle HR.

We’re a multi-tenant SaaS offerings company, automating HR-centric processes—encompassing the entire lifecycle of employee and business partner engagement. We have: 7000+ customers, 100+ million users and peak daily transaction rates of 1 BILLION+ per day.

We are looking for talented people who share in our vision to deliver continuous innovation in cloud that makes our customers successful. Join our high-energy, high-output, creative colleagues who inspire and challenge each other toward excellence.

We have
  • Best in the cloud space HCM application suited for Web and mobile devices

  • A team of aces to work with.
  • Top benefits, tuition reimbursement, catered lunches, and an onsite gym!
What you’ll do:
Position Title: SAP SuccessFactors iXp Intern – Developer
Location: Palo Alto, California (Virtual)
Expected start date to end date: June 7, 2021 – August 13, 2021

In this role, you’ll:
  • Have the unique opportunity to design, develop and deliver our new applications using Java and related technologies
  • Collaborate and innovate with Product, Design, and other engineering teams to deliver a seamless, consistent, and engaging product/experience for millions of users
  • Design and develop APIs and backend systems
Who you are:
We’re looking for someone who can challenge the status quo and likes to stay curious. You enjoy working on meaningful projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

  • Candidates to currently be enrolled in an undergraduate or master’s degree program which is applicable to the position (computer science or equivalent proven experience).
  • Java and related technologies
  • OOAD, algorithms, data structures, design patterns
  • DBMS concepts
  • Some experience with UI technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS
  • Willingness to “go the extra mile” to ensure the highest quality of experience for our customers

  • DevOps mindset – inherent sense of ownership through the development and deployment lifecycle

  • Technologies/Tools/Architectures you could enjoy: Cloud development, Microservices, Continuous Delivery, Spring Boot, Spring Reactor, Docker, Kubernetes, Swagger, Hadoop
WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. Manage a fast-paced experimentation roadmap across multiple areas, always evolving with the latest findings. Align with and advise longer-term product directions.
Engage with Uber executives through regular updates
Basic Qualifications
Actively pursuing a Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, statistics, design, computer science or related field with at least one semester/quarter left after completion of internship remaining

About the Team

The marketing team at Uber works across all lines of businesses and enables sustained growth at scale with hyper efficiency. The performance marketing team specifically focuses on digital advertising across multiple platforms (Social, Search, Job Boards) with marketing technology team building products to enable measurement, scale, and efficiency.

At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.

Full Job Description
By giving our customers and partners, some of which are Fortune Global 500 companies across all industries, the most flexible commerce platform, which is based on a Microservices, API-first, true cloud, and headless architecture (we call it the MACH architecture*), we are not only helping them maintain their competitive advantage but we are also changing the e-commerce platform market. Founded in Germany in 2006, our international expansion has reached Europe, the US and Asia Pacific. In October 2019, with a $145M investment from global venture capital and private equity firm Insight Partners, commercetools is in full gear going forward.

PRODUCT INTERN (RFP)

When large enterprises buy software, they often resort to putting Request for Proposals (RFPs) out, which are long questionnaires full of questions that help the buyer to evaluate options from different software vendors. Buyers can then evaluate different vendors head to head, using the same criteria. Unfortunately, the RFPs that buyers often use are badly outdated. We at commercetools invented an entirely modern approach to commerce that is not reflected well in RFPs. In 2018, we built ModernCommerceRFP.com which is a website used to generate RFPs for modern commerce. It's been use hundreds of times by large enterprises to generate RFPs and is widely seen as the standard for modern RFPs. We would like an intern to work directly for our Chief Product Officer to give ModernCommerceRFP.com a major refresh and expand it into adjacent products such as content and search.

In this internship, you would work with commercetools senior management to define the scope of the new ModernCommerceRFP.com, work with commercetools employees and partners to define update/extend the list of RFP questions, add the questions to the website, thoroughly test the functionality, and then lead a campaign to publicize its re-launch.

SKILLS + QUALIFICATIONS

Pursuing degrees in business and computer science
Ability to analyze RFPs (50% of role)
Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal (35% of role)
Light web development skills (15% of role)
Proactive approach to problem solving and excellent interpersonal skills

Check out our Career Page and our Website for more information.

We are all different and that is what makes us stronger! We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company better.

At commercetools, we are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

At commercetools, we hope to be the place where a diverse mix of talented people choose to come, stay and do their best work. We pride ourselves on bringing modern principles to ecommerce through both technology and company culture. We know success comes from the hard work and dedication of our passionate and creative employees.

Are you ready? Come grow with us!

Full Job Description

Responsibilities for this Position:
General Dynamics Mission Systems has an opening in Fairlakes, Virginia for an enthusiastic, innovative and dependable Business Development Intern who wants to jumpstart their career learning from an amazing team of professionals supporting the Surface Systems business including the Platform Integration, Modernization, Support and Sustainment. You will work with our team through each phase of formulation of strategy and business development activities for surface systems initiatives at GDMS, including supporting capture teams for new programs and business ventures, managing the allocated annual investment funds, and helping with development of long range strategic plans. The intern will brainstorm campaign ideas, develop marketing material, plan events, research client data, and perform some administrative work. The intern will report to the Director of Surface Systems.

Key Responsibilities:
The business development intern will be responsible for supporting and developing business strategy growing our market share within the Surface systems market. The intern will work with customers and industry partners and draw upon the broader capabilities of General Dynamics. Knowledge and experience in any or all of the following areas is strongly preferred: Software Engineering, Computer Science, Surface Combat Systems, Surface Command and Control, Surface Warfare Systems, Platform Integration and support and sustainment for surface systems. This position requires strong communication skills with the ability to rapidly grasp advanced technologies and how they may be applied to satisfy customer requirements. The successful candidate will also have demonstrated ability to work both independently and within highly motivated teams. The key to the success of M&SS is excellent leadership throughout the organization. We are looking for interns with leadership capabilities, who know how and when to drive to a solution. We seek and grow leaders who shape team/organization culture creating high morale, “lean forward” motivation and full engagement. The intern’s leadership style should scale where it is focused as the level of responsibilities change and it should incorporate effective communications. The interns we seek show a history of taking reasonable, managed risks in the absence of purity of information or a guarantee of success. Courage to deal with reality, removing any personal emotional involvement and looking at the facts with honesty and humility is another desired trait. Our interns think strategically and develop long lasting trusting relationships with customers and colleagues based on their track record of delivering on their commitments to each group. Experience in business development, program management, systems engineering, surface warfare systems, and an understanding government contracting procedures and business development methodologies, including bid and capture strategies, is preferred.

Additional Responsibilities:
Learns and supports our capture process for opportunities within the Surface Warfare market
Investigates and researches new business opportunities
Helps to build long range strategies and plans to acquire new business
Assists in the development of short and long-range business forecasts, sales plans, and marketing plans
Performs administrative, analytical and research activities in support of the business development and acquisition, strategic planning, proposal development and marketing functions
Assists in gathering data on competitors and analyzes their prices, sales and methods of operation
Analyzes and researches customer information, product/service preferences, market size, penetration, marketing practices and trends
Exercises creative thinking and idea generation to advance our business performance
Delivers innovative, flexible, integrated solutions to meet customers’ changing business needs
Follows industry trends and pursues technology innovation to ensure GDMS’ offerings are cost competitive and superior to industry leading capabilities and best practices
Participates in promotional activities and trade shows, working with developers, advertisers, and production managers, to market products and services

Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 13,000 top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

Learn how you’ll grow through your internship with General Dynamics Mission Systems.

REASONING ABILITY

description:
Full Job Description
Why Intern at Health Care Service Corporation?

Health Care Service Corporation (HCSC), a Mutual Legal Reserve Company and an Independent Licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association, is the largest customer-owned health insurer in the United States and fourth largest overall, operating through our Blue Cross and Blue Shield® Plans in Illinois, Montana, New Mexico, Oklahoma and Texas. HCSC affiliates and subsidiaries such as Dearborn National®, TMG Health and Medecision, offer group life, disability and dental solutions, as well as a range of other individual solutions. The company, founded in 1936, serves nearly 15 million members across five states and employs more than 21,000 people in over 60 local offices. HCSC is dedicated to expanding access to high quality, cost effective health care and equipping our members with information and tools so they can make the best health care decisions for themselves and their families. Our health plans were pioneers in their states, as they were the first to provide coverage for a number of procedures ranging from heart and bone marrow transplants, to cancer and leukemia treatments. Today, we are leaders in the development of value-based care models to spur greater collaboration and accountability among various stakeholders to improve the health care experience for patients and consumers and enable them lead healthier lives.

** This ten-week paid internship is located in Chicago, IL. **

What Are Your Responsibilities?

The intern will work with business analysts to assist in the preparation of business requirements for new or ongoing client projects. Tasks may include interviewing business leads to document business needs; assisting with meeting facilitation including the recording of meeting minutes; drafting requirements; adhering to project timeline milestones; preparing presentations.

  • Execute various systems, integration, regression, and ad-hoc tests according to test plans
  • Ensure the creation of weekly testing dashboards – reports on test preparation and execution status
  • Raise issues and risks to testing timeline such as deliverable hand off delays, environment readiness issues, etc.
  • Manage defect reports for issues found during testing, and provide accurate testing status to project stakeholders
  • Attend daily status phone calls with Test Managers to report testing statuses and issues
What Do You Need To Be Successful?

– Previous internship experience preferred
– Strong analytical and problem solving skills
– Detail oriented
– Ability to work effectively, independently and collaborate within a team environment
– Practical, developed PC skills, proficient in Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word, Access and Excel).
– Possess an interest in pursuing a career in Health Insurance and/or Information Technology
– Project management and customer service skills with an ability to handle multiple projects
– Demonstrated strong interpersonal communication skills including verbal and written communication

What Are the Requirements You Must Meet?

– Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in MIS, Business with an IT focus, Computer Science or other related STEM, technical or analytic focused degree program
– Graduation date between December 2021 – June 2022
– A minimum GPA of 3.0/4.0
– Availability to work 10 weeks during the summer

What Does the Internship Program Entail?

– Formal Intern Orientation to build business and industry acumen
– Challenging real-world hands-on project
– Weekly networking opportunities among interns and company leaders
– Professional development workshops
– Business Resource Group involvement
– Volunteer activities

LitePoint creates wireless test solutions and services for the world’s most innovative wireless device makers, helping them to ensure their products perform for today’s demanding consumers. A leading innovator in wireless testing, LitePoint products come out of the box ready to test the most widely used wireless chipsets in the world. LitePoint works with the leading makers of smartphones, tablets, PCs, wireless access points and chipsets. LitePoint is also at the forefront of testing the burgeoning world of connected devices…the Internet of Things. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, California and with offices around the world. Full Job Description
GoGuardian is on a mission to transform education by helping to protect students in the digital space from harmful and distracting content and supporting their mental health. We partner with schools to identify learning patterns and maximize the academic potential of every student. With GoGuardian, educators can engage students with more effective resources while also promoting online accessibility in the most applicable way for their school population.

GoGuardian’s Engineering team is growing, and we're looking for interns to join the team. You'll work with a variety of technologies, including Terraform, AWS/GCP, Docker, Linux, etc. Interns will be paired with Data Infrastructure and Security Engineers to provide guidance and mentorship. Ideal candidates should have some technical experience in the above mentioned areas or be interested in learning them.
What You'll Do
Learn the GoGuardian tech stack and embody engineering best practices
Deliver quality, scalable, and maintainable software that fulfills internal and external needs
Contribute to building tools and automation to manage and enforce security policies and automate processes at scale
Who You Are
Eager to learn modern tooling and technology to reinforce web apps that impact education
Excited to study, learn, and experiment with new technologies outside of your comfort zone
An effective communicator and collaborator with engineering and other departments
Able to write maintainable quality code
Pursuing a BS, BA, or MS degree (bonus if the degree is in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or InfoSec)
Experienced with or understanding of how production-ready software is shipped
Professional, humble, and empathetic, with a mind for Engineering soft skills
Possessing a strong grasp of at least one modern programming language
What We Offer
Opportunity to impact and revolutionize safe digital learning experiences for K-12 students
Partner with enthusiastic and talented colleagues who are compelled to do good in the world
Weekly yoga classes and guided aromatherapy meditation
Grow and learn with one of the fastest growing EdTech companies
GoGuardian is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. GoGuardian does not discriminate against employees, applicants, interns or volunteers on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, sex, age, sexual orientation, military and veteran status, registered domestic partner status, genetic information, gender, gender identity, gender expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

position: Business Intelligence / Data Analyst | Entry Level - Internship
description:
Full Job Description

Business Intelligence Developer (Fast track)

  • Maintain, support, and enhance the business intelligence data backend, including data warehouses and data lakes.
  • Build interfaces between the business intelligence systems and other college information systems to maintain a timely and accurate integration of data.
  • Collaborate and work with data analysts in various departments to ensure that data meets their reporting and analysis needs.
  • Provide technical guidance for design and implementation of data governance systems and policy.
  • Work extensively towards SQL Server development in writing core TSQL scripts to implement complex business logics.
  • Develop SSIS packages to implement complex ETL strategies as a part of business requirements for population of dimensional data structures.
  • Work on creating SSAS cubes and various cube objects such as KPIs (Key Performance Indicators), calculated members, attributes hierarchies and perspectives.
  • Design eye-catching reports with data from OLTP database, dimensional data structure and OLAP cubes for business reporting purposes.
  • Keep abreast of new business intelligence technologies

Qualifications

  • BS or MS of degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or related field is required
  • At least 1 year of experience using Microsoft SQL Server Database, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS is required
  • Experience with other relational databases, BI reporting and data discovery tools is preferred

Data Analyst – Internship/Entry Level

Responsibilities:
· Provides plan with data, reporting and analyses that enable data driven decision making.
· Provides summary analyses in written and oral presentation settings.
· Builds database from scratch. And prepares complex presentations.
· Develops system test cases and documents results, researches system issues and documents findings.
Requirements:
· Bachelor’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics
· Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms
· Understanding of addressing and metadata standards
· High-level written and verbal communication skills

Junior Data Analyst

Responsibilities:
· Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.
· Managing users and user roles.
· Provide quality assurance of imported data, working with quality assurance analyst if necessary.
· Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets.
· Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines.
· Helping develop reports and analysis.
· Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.
· Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements.
· Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization.
· Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems.
· Generating reports from single or multiple systems.
· Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports.
· Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems.
· Training end users on new reports and dashboards.
· Providing technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.
Requirements:
· Bachelor’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics
· 1-3 years of work experience as a data analyst or in related field is preferred
· Ability to work with stakeholders to assess potential risks.
· Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations.
· Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms.
· High-level experience in methodologies and processes for managing large scale databases.
· Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.
· Understanding of addressing and metadata standards.
· High-level written and verbal communication skills.

position: Consulting Summer Associate, Analytics & Data Strategy
description:
Full Job Description

Consulting Summer Associate, Analytics & Data Strategy
Chicago, IL; New York, NY; Remote
About Breakwater Solutions
Breakwater helps mitigate risk and gain insight from sprawling information by combining technology automation and human expertise. Our expert consulting, software, and managed services address the challenges within information governance, disputes and investigations, regulatory compliance, privacy, and cybersecurity.

Breakwater launched in 2020 with technology from IBM and private equity funding from JLL Partners. We are a global hyper-growth company. It is an exciting time to join us!
Job Summary
Summer associates will have the opportunity to work on a variety of consulting engagements, learn from technical training sessions and challenges, engage in valuable internal initiatives, and participate in social events. The program is designed to develop technical and business skills, provide hands-on consulting experience, and build relationships with professionals across the firm.
Responsibilities
Summer associates will be immersed in a real consulting experience, including skills development, team building, client engagements, and fun. To start, summer associates will participate in a series of technical trainings which will provide the foundational skillsets for client engagements and technical challenges. Summer associates will then work closely with Breakwater professionals to contribute to real client engagements, which could include designing and building technical workflows, interpreting results of data analyses, reporting findings to other project team members, and preparing client-ready deliverables. In addition to client work, summer associates will participate in technical challenges – projects based on real client issues that require critical thinking and creative problem-solving. Additionally, the internship program provides the opportunity to research new technologies and present a business case for adoption and use. Summer associates will also participate in various social events and a day of community service. Breakwater offers full-time positions to high-performing summer associates.
Skills + Qualifications

  • Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, MIS, Mathematics, Engineering, Finance, Economics, or a similar analytical discipline
  • Analytical approach to problem-solving
  • Attention to detail
  • Critical thinking
  • Commitment to quality
  • Strong written and verbal communication
  • Ability to succeed in a team environment

Full Job Description
About Nokia

We create the critical networks and technologies to bring together the world’s intelligence, across businesses, cities, supply chains and societies. With our commitment to innovation and technology leadership, driven by the award-winning Nokia Bell Labs, we deliver networks at the limits of science across mobile, infrastructure, cloud, and enabling technologies. Adhering to the highest standards of integrity and security, we help build the capabilities we need for a more productive, sustainable and inclusive world.

About Nokia Bell Labs

Do you want to change the world?
Do you want to invent the future?
Are you looking for meaningful real-world experience?

Then Nokia Bell Labs, the Nobel Prize winning research organization, is for you. We are currently accepting applications for our intern program.

Nokia Bell Labs is building the future – connecting all humans, all senses, all things, all systems, all infrastructure, all processes. Discovering the possibilities that shape the human experience are at the heart of everything we do. Our interns will have the opportunity to learn from and work with industry leading experts, and the best and brightest minds, who solve the most formidable challenges confronting our world through disruptive innovation and research.

Projects for the 2021 internship cover technologies such as 5G&6G, augmented intelligence, smart devices, IoT, data analytics, robotics, AI, cloud technologies and more…

As well as providing hands-on educational and collaborative experiences for a pool of talented and highly motivated students, our internship program will expand your field of study by exposing you to an unparalleled diversity of people, expertise and perspectives. In classic Bell Labs style, you will leave changed forever by an experience that will redefine your future.

Job Description

Bell Labs is a worldwide research and development community that focuses its efforts on key technologies for telecommunications. It is internationally renowned as the birthplace of modern information theory, the transistor, the laser and the UNIX operating system. Nowadays we are working on the network of 2020. In this new scenario of interconnected things, people will, almost more than ever before, matter. The Social Dynamics team in Cambridge UK works on the idea of a society empowered by digital data. As part of the emerging research area of “Computational Social Science”, the team answers questions typical of the social sciences using computational methods. The team provides a vibrant multidisciplinary research environment with close links to top academics. A successful candidate is expected to have experience in the areas of Technology and Society, Visualization and Interaction Design, or Data Science.

Job Responsibilities & Competencies

Carry out an active and ambitious research project.

Publish the outcomes of the research in major scientific venues worldwide, including top conferences and journals.

Generate intellectual property through the patenting of ideas.

Highly valued:
Proven record of publication(s), particularly in conference venues such as WWW, CHI, KDD, and CSCW, and journals such as PNAS and Science.

Experience in development activities is also highly valued.

Qualifications

Ability to conduct independent research while also contributing to team-oriented projects that often span across multiple Bell Labs sites

Strong written and spoken communications skills, able to participate in robust discussions in English.

Good research skills.

Versatile, flexible, hands-on, and a self-starter.

Student Criteria:
Overall GPA of 3.0/4.0 or above.
Must be enrolled as a full-time student.

Work Authorization: U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident preferred. Will accept students on F-1 Visa dependent upon program requirements or may consider sponsoring short-term J1 Visa PhD students dependent upon program requirements.

Education Requested: Ideally be pursuing a PhD degree in computer science, information science, interaction design, engineering or any related field from an accredited college/university.

Working with us, you will have a positive impact on people's lives and help to overcome some of the world's most pressing challenges. We act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. At Nokia, employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Nokia culture welcomes people as their true selves.

Full Job Description
Ekata provides global identity verification via enterprise-grade APIs and a SaaS solution. Our product suite is powered by Ekata Identity Engine, the first and only cross-border identity engine of its kind. It uses complex machine learning algorithms across the five consumer attributes of email, phone, name, physical address, and IP to derive unique data links and features from billions of real-time transactions within our customer network and the globally sourced data of our graph. Businesses around the world including Alipay, Stripe, Airbnb, and Microsoft leverage our solutions to approve more good transactions, reduce friction, and find fraud.

We are looking for a Software Engineering Intern to be based out of Seattle, who thrives on designing, coding, and maintaining high performance data processing applications on the JVM platform (primarily in Clojure and Scala), running on AWS.

Your ideal internship should be one where you work in a small team and are empowered to make yourself and your team more productive on a daily basis. You should want to be part of a team where your desire to grow and learn are valued and aptly rewarded; where using and contributing to open source are looked upon as an asset; where innovating and executing are core to your teams' beliefs.

As a Software Engineering Intern, you will:
Write performant code and write automated test to validate correctness of code
Develop and deploy large-scale microservices and/or data processing systems
Meet development milestones and business requirements on schedule
Independently analyze, propose and develop solutions for technical problems and issues
Ensure the adherence to the standards and procedures that result in an environment compliant with information security policy

Our ideal Software Engineering Intern will have:
A willingness to learn new languages and techniques to solve challenging problems.
Experience in functional programming fundamentals.
BS degree in Computer Science, related degree or equivalent. Graduating before August 2022.
Ability to write clean code that works, is readable, maintainable and follows best practices and coding standards
Understanding of OO and functional design, languages, algorithms and data structures
A philosophy of iteration and continuous improvement
A desire to own design and architecture end to end

Unwavering in our pursuit of standardizing global identity data, we are approachable, real people that genuinely care about the success of those we partner with. With a commitment to service, innovation, and ownership, Ekata is a dynamic place to work for folks who want to make an impact on a global scale. We provide learning & development opportunities for each employee and promote work-life flexibility through self-managed time off. Headquartered in downtown Seattle, Ekata is growing internationally with offices in Budapest, Hungary, Amsterdam, and in Singapore.

To learn more about the experience of working at Ekata visit: https://ekata.com/careers/

Ekata prides itself on celebrating diversity, inclusivity, and being an equal-opportunity employer.

Full Job Description
This role offers an undergraduate or graduate student an outstanding real-world introduction to commercial threat intelligence, one of the fastest-growing parts of the Information Security market.

Recorded Future is a guardian of the internet. We defend against cyber attacks by analyzing the open web, deep web, and dark web. Our harvesting pipeline reads over 800,000 web sources and structured data feeds, and our real-time multilingual natural language processing technology takes that content from raw text to alerts and visualizations in minutes.

Data Science Team takes ownership of this unique dataset in support of our clients. We implement crucial harvesting capabilities, manipulate our data structures to obtain solutions and insights, and explore new use cases and capabilities for the data. The chosen candidate on the Data Science team will support the Recorded Future Public Sector group.

We're looking for smart and ambitious people with a strengthening engineering foundation and a quantitative mindset to help us take this on. In this role, you will implement new techniques for extracting high fidelity information from our vast collection of data, and what you help build will become part of our Threat Intelligence product to help our Public Sector clients stay protected. You will join a team of motivated people working on a tough problem, and help us shine a light into the dark corners of the internet.

You will learn:
From co-workers with decades of experience working in a wide variety of fields - everything from globally recognized tech-entrepreneurs to ex-intelligence Agency vets, to Ph.D.'s in advanced sciences

About the field of cybersecurity in the public sector industries.

About the field of Machine Learning and how we utilized massive sets of data to power our product

Qualifications:
Required experience and skills:
Technical education: Working towards BA, BS, or MS in Computer Science or related discipline, with a strong academic record.

Python Programming: some experience or equivalent academic background in data processing using Python is preferred.

Data skills: Excited to work with large, complex data structures. You love working with heterogeneous data to answer real human questions, and you want to learn how to write the code that makes that happen.

Excellent communication: Your clarity of thought is always apparent in your crisp and articulate emails, Slack chats, phone calls, and in-person conversations.

Why should you join Recorded Future?
From over 35 nationalities, our Futurists are the perfect recipe of humility, accountability, and collaborative attitudes. Our dedication to empowering clients with elite intelligence to disrupt adversaries has earned us a 4.7-star user rating from Gartner and 8 of the top 10 Fortune 100 companies as clients.

Want more info?
Blog & Podcast: Learn everything you want to know (and maybe some things you'd rather not know) about the world of cyber threat intelligence
Instagram & Twitter: What's happening at Recorded Future
The Record: The Record is a cybersecurity news publication that explores the untold stories in this rapidly changing field
Timeline: History of Recorded Future

We are committed to maintaining an environment that attracts and retains talent from a diverse range of experiences, backgrounds and lifestyles. By ensuring all feel included and respected for being unique and bringing their whole selves to work, Recorded Future is made a better place every day.

Job Title
Intern - Machine Learning & Data Science – Cambridge, MA- 2021

Job Description

Intern- Machine Learning & Data Science – Cambridge, MA – Summer 2021

Are you interested in an Intern opportunity with Philips? We welcome individuals who are currently pursuing a graduate (MS) or PhD to participate in a 3 month paid internship at our Cambridge site. Through this role, you will gain meaningful, hands-on experience in engineering for a HealthTech company.

In this role, you have the opportunity to

Contribute to novel algorithm development using our large, in-house healthcare datasets.

You are responsible for

Data curation and developing machine learning models for clinical decision support

Evaluating and validating model results on test datasets

Summarizing and reporting results in the form of a scientific paper and presentation.

You are a part of

A large team of data scientists, computer science and biomedical engineers who work on building machine and deep learning-based tools to enable clinicians to anticipate patient needs and make better care decisions.

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

Current Ph.D. or M.S. candidate in Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering, or Statistics

Proficient in machine/deep learning

Experience in working with SQL databases & Apache Spark

Knowledge of Python programming language

Experience with large clinical datasets

Ability to work independently, as well as part of a team

Good communication & presentation skills

In return, we offer you

The ability to collaborate with, learn and grow from colleagues in a highly complex, global organization where you can use your strengths to help drive strategic business initiatives for Philips. Additionally, we provide you a dynamic working environment in an innovative business, paired with a competitive salary, excellent benefits, and a supportive atmosphere where you can sharpen your talents with new challenges and career opportunities.

US work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa.

Company relocation benefits will not be provided for this position. Candidates need to live within the territory or within commuting distance to Cambridge, MA.

Working at Philips is more than a job. Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. A graduate student, or undergraduate at least in 3rd year of computer science or computer engineering studies; passionate about Linux, operating systems, computer systems, and open source development.

Experience with git desired

Culture

Enovation Controls has built a company and culture by living out their core values. They are looking for hungry, humble and smart people who will embrace their core values and thrive in a culture that is fun and rewarding. Description

We are recruiting two students for our intern program. We are specifically looking for undergraduate or graduate level students actively enrolled in an accredited college program of Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or related field.

These internships run year-round, full-time during the summer and part-time during the school year (approximately 10 hours per week around classes). This role will work collaboratively on a daily basis with our Software Engineering department.

The internship assignments are designed to provide the engineering students real-life work experience and training in the day-to-day activities in a manufacturing facility. Our internships are part of our recruiting strategy to attract and retain qualified highly qualified talent.

Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or related field.
Minimum of a 3.0 GPA

Ability to meet deadlines and goals in a fast-paced environment.
Problem solving skills.
Writing software in C and C++ using the standard template library (STL) in a POSIX style operating system, i.e.: Linux.
Comfortable working in and around embedded systems with application processors in an OS like Linux, Raspberry Pi, etc.

description:
Full Job Description
The Well Living Lab (WLL) is looking for a Software Engineer intern (up to 5 months) to support our application development and technological capabilities. This position leverages the unique opportunity and collaboration between Delos and Mayo Clinic which the lab is built upon. This person will work closely with the Well Living Lab Technology Director, senior technology team members, and the rest of the lab's team to develop and support applications and solutions which support the innovative research being done at the lab. In this position, you will have the opportunity to work with our cutting-edge technology in the lab to support our ongoing research on how the indoor environmental factors impact human health and well-being.

Responsibilities:
Work collaboratively with the WLL technology team to:
Develop and support the lab's application portfolio, IoT, and Cloud capabilities
Support the lab's existing technologies such as environmental sensors and biometric devices
Develop and support the technologies that meet the requirements and specifications of WLL research projects, working in coordination with the research team

Prerequisite Qualifications:
College undergraduate Juniors or above; Bachelor's degree or above, in one or more of the following fields:
Software Engineering
Computer Science
Information Technology
Computer Engineering
Software development experience in Angular, JavaScript, C#, Python, or other similar programming languages
Experience in web development
Experience working with Cloud providers and technologies, such as Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, or AWS
Experience with databases and SQL
Ability to thrive in self-managed and team-based work
Enthusiasm to learn, use and develop innovative research skills, technologies, and tools
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and effective time management skills

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with building IoT devices via technologies such as Raspberry Pi or Arduino is a plusExperience in developing and integrating with IoT devices is a big plusKnowledge of IT infrastructure and network is a plusExperience working with biometric and physiological wearable devices
Experience working in a research and multidisciplinary team setting
Creativity - there's always a way; sometimes we just haven't found it yet.

Applicants are selected based upon their qualifications for this position and without regard to the applicant's race, color, ethnic or national origin, religion, creed, age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, marital or partnership status, citizenship or alienage status, veteran status, whether children are, may be or would be residing with a person, or any other characteristic protected by law.

About the Well Living Lab:
The Well Living Lab, a Delos and Mayo Clinic collaboration, was created to research the real-world impact of indoor environments on human health and well-being and generate evidence-based information that can be used in practical ways to create healthier indoor spaces. For more information about the Lab, visit www.welllivinglab.com.

About Delos:
As the pioneer of Wellness Real Estate™ and founder of the WELL Building Standard®, Delos is transforming our homes, offices, schools, and other indoor environments by placing health and wellness at the center of design and construction decisions. The Delos platform includes research, consulting, merchandising, and programming and licensing innovative solutions for the built environment, creating spaces that nurture and promote human health and wellbeing.

Exploring the intersection between humans and the built environment, Delos creates spaces that actively contribute to human health, performance and wellbeing by marrying the best innovations in technology, health, science, design, and enterprise. We see the built-environment as an asset to maximize human-potential and envision environments that enhance us. Environments that are proactive, enabling us to live better by cultivating better lifestyle choices and by solving health problems before they are created. We have broadened the scope of environmental sustainability, extending the concept beyond the best of green technology to an integrated solution that addresses human sustainability.

Our mission is to build a better world. Join us.

For additional information, please visit us at www.delos.com

Job Description

Our mission is to redefine the home experience through intelligently designed products and services delivered to every home by people who care.

Dedicated to redefining the home experience with intelligent products and services, Vivint serves more than one million customers throughout the U.S. and Canada. Vivint is the largest tech employer in Utah, a certified Great Place to Work, and one of Fast Company’s World’s 50 Most Innovative Companies for 2017.

The Role:
The Product Analytics Intern will be working directly with our product analytics team helping to uncover insights for our Innovation center. They will work closely with Product Managers and get real hands on experience solving real world problems related to cutting costs and increasing revenue. The position is part-time and hour and open for 30hrs/week during the summer and open to 10-15hrs/wk during the school semesters if summer goes well. Undergraduates preferred, but masters students are welcome to apply.

What you will be working on:
Understanding outside factors affecting how our products perform
Helping analysts and product managers think through what to measure in order to define success
Communicate with the product teams to generate requirements and present results that help key stakeholders make effective decisions.
Engage with our business intelligence group to gain a deep understanding of existing systems, the underlying data, and how that data can support the product teams.
Work in a fast-paced, self-directed, agile environment.
Using a “problem statement” structure, clearly define the desired outcome, including analytic results and resulting actions.

Critical thinker
Creative Problem Solver
Someone interested in data and curious about how data affects business situations

At TrailStone we believe in shared success for our investors and our employees. Success is driven by exceptional people working together as a team with a passion for the mission and common values.

TrailStone is a global energy trader and risk manager. Our mission is to play a leading role in facilitating the worldwide transition to renewable power.
