position: Radio Systems Bell Labs Summer Intern
description:
Full Job Description
About Nokia

At Nokia we create the technology to connect the world. Developing and delivering the industry's only end-to-end portfolio of network equipment, software, services and licensing that is available globally. Through our research teams, including the world-renowned Nokia Bell Labs, Nokia is leading the world to adopt end-to-end 5G networks that are faster, more secure and capable of revolutionizing lives, economies and societies. Nokia adheres to the highest ethical business standards as we create technology with social purpose, quality and integrity. A truly global company, we are 160 nationalities working in more than 100 countries.

About Nokia Bell Labs

Over its nearly 100-year history, Nokia Bell Labs has invented many of the foundational technologies that underpin information and communication networks and all digital devices and systems. This research has resulted in nine Nobel Prizes, four Turing Awards, three Japan Prizes and a plethora of National Medals of Science and Engineering, as well three Emmys, two Grammys and an Oscar for technical innovations. Nokia Bell Labs continues to conduct disruptive research focused on solving the challenges of the new digital era and innovating the technology that will define the next industrial revolution.

Job Description

The internship positions involve exploration of new wireless communications concepts through analysis and simulation. Specifically, the intern will apply new machine learning techniques including deep learning to wireless communication problems involving radio propagation prediction, traffic prediction and resource allocation, for example, for spectrum sharing and multi-TRP transmission in mmWave.

Job Responsibilities & Competencies

Propose and evaluate novel algorithms for optimizing the performance of wireless communication systems
System level modelling of wireless communication systems in various frequency bands, in particular, mm wave bands, for various performance studies
Investigate and choose appropriate neural network models as applicable to the specific problem
Development of simulation code according to proposed system models to produce relevant metrics for comparison against well-chosen baselines
Disseminate research internally and externally through presentations, conference and journal publication

Qualifications

M.S. / Ph.D. student in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Mathematics or related fields
Solid understanding of radio systems and technologies with some knowledge of 4G/5G
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Programming with Python/Matlab/C/C++
Familiarity with AI/ML knowledge and programming tools desirable
Working knowledge of MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel

Desired Skills:
Ability to quickly learn and apply new technologies and design strategies
Able to collaborate both with the immediate team as well as others in the larger Bell Labs community as need arises
Positive attitude, and ready to take on challenges
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Good writing skills

Student Criteria: Overall GPA of 3.0/4.0 or above. Must be enrolled as a full-time student.

Work Authorization: U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident preferred. Will accept students on F-1 Visa dependent upon program requirements.

Imagine creating technology that has the potential to change the world. Working with us, you will have a positive impact on people’s lives and help to overcome some of the world’s most pressing challenges. We act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. At Nokia, employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Nokia culture welcomes people as their true selves.

Full Job Description
"Going to space is just the beginning. It’s what you do when you get there that matters. Lockheed Martin builds the satellites and spacecraft that do amazing things in space for government and commercial customers. Connecting people. Advancing discovery. And protecting what matters most. Lockheed Martin-built satellites give earlier warning of severe weather, connect troops on the battlefield, and deliver GPS directions to a billion people worldwide.
As we look to the future, we’re driving innovations to help our customers do even more in orbit. That’s why we’re crafting smarter satellites that operate like smartphones in the sky, with apps that can be updated in orbit so they can adapt as mission needs on the ground change. Your mission is ours. And as that mission evolves, we’ll be ready. Will you?
What does this role look like?
You will support testing of a major program subsystem. Specific duties will include assisting the certified test conductor on the oversight of subsystem testing. This position will work closely with technical experts and test support staff to meet the demanding needs of our programs."

Actively enrolled in a Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Math or other related degree program from an accredited college/university. Experience or classroom knowledge of test engineering knowledge, experience with testing hardware, software. Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
job.Qualifications

Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.

As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.

Full Job Description
Eterneva is completely changing how we culturally view death and honoring our loved ones. We’re here to bring a totally different tone to the funeral space, and ensure remarkable people aren’t forgotten!

You're detailed-oriented, a builder, and love project work. You're a lover of technology, spreadsheets, and process. You might be a Math, Computer Science, or Accounting major and looking to gain hands-on experience before graduating. Numbers and logic are your best friend. You're someone who's good with repeatable work needing to be done in an orderly and systematic way. You're a hard-worker and incredibly detail-oriented, and take a lot of pride in the quality and consistency of your work. You consider yourself logical and a problem-solver, so when there isn't a process clearly-defined, you're able to think critically recommend a potential solution before asking for help.

You know that joining a startup means you're a team player ready to roll up your sleeves and help wherever the business needs!

TO APPLY:
1. Take our required hiring survey: https://www.cindexinc.com/users/ciims/processes/surveyInfo.php?USER_ID=52035&COMPANY_CODE=SuMaAdnw73&h2=1562016740

2. Show us you're serious in your cover letter! Let us know what about this role excites you, and why you're uniquely qualified to do great work!

ABOUT ETERNEVA

Eterneva is a celebration of life company, that honors the lives of remarkable people and pets by turning their ashes into real diamonds.

The diamond is an extraordinarily special way to memorialize a loved one because it’s bright, it’s personal, and it’s forever.

The eight-month journey to create the diamond is just as special. We send monthly pictures, videos, updates so as to give our customers something to look forward to during a tough time, and as a result, many say we change their relationship to grief.

It’s extraordinarily meaningful work, and we make raving fans out of every customer we serve. They’ll fly across the country to visit us and send us handwritten letters to thank us for some much-needed brightness, and for impacting their life.

It’s our belief that remarkable people shouldn’t be forgotten, and it’s about time we brought meaning and celebration to end of life, instead of putting it in a box.

We’re garnering a ton of attention for our fresh approach - we recently made Inc’s 30 Under 30 list and the cover of Inc Magazine. We’ve been featured on Yahoo Finance, Viceland’s 2 Chainz Most Expensivist, On the Money, and are doing diamonds for multiple celebrities.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Document processes for various department usage
Prepare reports for Sales, Customer Experience, Finance, and Operations departments
Assist as needed with systems build, integrations, and implementations

QUALIFICATIONS

We are looking for someone passionate about the Eterneva mission

You are detail oriented and hyper-organized

You're a self-starter but also great at following an established process

You love numbers and logic and could look at spreadsheets and data all day

You’re a stickler for the tiniest details being just right

You're a team player all the way

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS

$15/hr

15-20 hrs/week

Temporary position with potential to be extended

Able to serve as supervisor for academic internship credit if desired

description:
Full Job Description
Grainger Overview

At Grainger, we’re committed to our purpose – We Keep the World Working. Grainger is a leading global supplier of maintenance, repair, and operational supplies, providing services and solutions for every industry. Our 25,000 employees are driven to serve customers and the community in exceptional ways; focusing on delivering the highest level of service leveraging the most innovative solutions. In the Grainger Technology Group, we deliver the technology platforms, systems, and services that power the Grainger business. As part of a high-performing team, you’ll be able to develop your talents and make a difference. Grainger is a Fortune 500 company and a perennial member of Fortune magazine's Most Admired Companies list.

The Program

The GTG internship is a 10 week program. You will work alongside team members on functionality that has a direct impact to the business. Throughout the summer, there will be plenty of time for networking, professional development, and social events. At the end of the internship, you will present your work to senior leadership.

The internship is paid and virtual for summer 2021.

The Role

We are looking for engineers with strong technical skills in various disciplines including data engineering, data visualization, cloud infrastructure engineering, performance and site reliability, networking, security, mobile development, web development, and more. You will contribute your skills to a specific team and may have the opportunity to work with your intern peers on additional projects. Through your work and other development opportunities, you will grow your technical skills and understand how our technology stack empowers our business to serve our customers.

Responsibilities

Design, build, test, and deploy innovative software solutions
Develop new features, identify and implement bugfixes
Operate effectively in an Agile development environment
Demonstrate strong analytical skills; Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Display a proactive, results oriented attitude; superb work ethic and flexibility to work in an environment of constant change

Qualifications

Pursuing a B.S. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent practical experience
Experience in one or more general purpose programming language
Ability to learn new programming languages
Preferred major GPA of 3.0 or higher
Expected graduation with a Bachelors or Masters degree between Winter 2021 – Spring 2022
Does not require sponsorship

Grainger is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Full Job Description
At a glance:

Leavened is a marketing technology and media measurement company. Leavened’s products are designed to help marketers increase the ROI of their marketing investment.

What does a Summer Intern do at Leavened?

Get hands on experience on the Leavened development team while also getting exposure marketing analytics through our team of data scientists.

Learn how the team takes data from clients, runs data through our tools and turns it into marketing insights.

Work as an extension of your team contributing to the success of our clients’ campaigns.

Use a list of specific learning objectives for your
Learn the ins and outs of product develop and programming to gain transferrable skills to get you jump-started in your career.

What makes a great Summer Intern at Leavened?

You are a current student in pursuit of an Associates, Bachelors or Graduate degree at an accredited institution in Computer Science, Python and Java experience a plus. Preference given to rising juniors or upcoming graduates.

Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Take direction well.
High degree of organizational abilities that surpass the norm.

Full Job Description
THE COMPANY

For more than 170 years, National Life Group (“NLG”) has aimed to keep our promises to provide families stability in good times and in bad. Throughout that history, we have provided peace of mind to those families as they plan their futures.

As a mission-driven business, the cause of what we do is as important as the products we sell, and our cause is a very simple one, directed at the people who live and work on America’s Main Streets: to “Do Good” in our communities and with the individual families we serve.

Sentinel Investments, the investment management company of NLG, manages approximately $30 billion in AUM. Our purpose is simple – to allow NLG to keep its promises. How we do this – an obsessive focus on delivering investment results. We drive results through a rigorous and collaborative investment process and we hold ourselves to the highest of standards, both as investors and teammates. While our process is based on rigor, our culture is based on our guiding principles: Meritocracy, Uncompromising Transparency, Intellectual Honesty, Performance Driven Learning, and Relentless Pursuit of Excellence. These principles guide the way we conduct ourselves, how we work together, and how we approach every investment decision. We fulfill our responsibilities while acting with integrity and humility, while focusing on what is right for the firm, and ultimately, our policyholders. Our culture has been deliberately built to nurture inclusiveness and curiosity, and provide opportunities to learn and grow, both as people and investors. The flat and collaborative nature of our team promotes an atmosphere where the best ideas are continually expressed and rewarded. Our pursuit of excellence is unwavering.

THE POSITION

Position Title Trading Analytics Intern

Reports to Head of Trading

Position Summary

Supporting the Structured Products and Trading teams, the Trading Analytics Intern will aid development of analytical systems and reporting for analysts and traders designed to aid the investment decision and transaction process. The high impact role will offer exposure to key areas of the National Life fixed income investment process.

Responsibilities

Create and improve analytical tools that aid analysts and traders in understanding and visualizing complex data sets
Integrate insights into practical workflows utilizing Excel, Tableau / Microsoft BI, and email-based reporting
Learn trading and analytical workflows and apply technical skills to improve and automate processes
Improve ad-hoc desk analytics and assist in developing repeatable processes for research analysts and traders

THE PERSON

Pivotal Experience & Expertise

Candidate for undergraduate or advanced degree in Financial Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science or a related field of study
Experience with either a workplace or academic setting in quantitative financial analysis and/or development roles
Experience using Excel, Microsoft BI, Tableau, and other data visualization tools, and the ability to demonstrate capabilities as part of the interview process
Skilled in SQL and Python; knowledge of additional programming languages considered helpful
Experience with code development best practices
Intense intellectual curiosity with the desire to seek new challenges while continuously learning
Solid interpersonal skills and ability to connect to form meaningful working partnerships
Inclusive team player with a collaborative and cooperative approach
Strong work ethic and proactive professional disposition
Experience driving projects to completion

Cultural Fit

Results-driven mindset
Thrives in a collaborative environment where the best ideas that drive the best results are rewarded
Has the integrity to communicate all relevant facts and information in evaluating decisions and the humility to admit what you do not know
Love of learning – comfortable in an organization that seeks to continually learn from its mistakes and successes to drive better investment decisions
Comfortable with ambiguity and the mentality required to address and ultimately own those ambiguous situations – finding answers and solutions
Proficient in giving and receiving constructive feedback in both real time and structured environments
Demonstrates transparent, direct, and open communication across the organization
Promotes collaboration and has a “firm first” attitude – does what is right for National Life Group
Commitment to our mission and values

Sentinel Investments® is the unifying brand name for Sentinel Financial Services Company (Member FINRA), Sentinel Asset Management, Inc., and Sentinel Administrative Services, Inc. National Life Group is a trade name of National Life Insurance Company (Montpelier VT) and its affiliates. All companies referenced are affiliated.

This role is not open to applicants residing in Colorado effective 1/1/2021

Full Job Description
Our Story

From our humble beginnings as sports parents and coaches, we founded Stack Sports to transform the youth sports experience by helping other parents, coaches and administrators manage all aspects of their sports organizations. By developing easy-to-use team management and related solutions, we allow parents, players and coaches to focus on the game - not administrative duties. Our founders and employees wear many hats; successful entrepreneurs, loving parents, sports enthusiasts, community volunteers. Being able to juggle all the important aspects of life can be challenging as sports parents.

Our Values

Play to Win - Strive for greatness every day. Results count
Be a Team Player - Commit to collective success. Be anchored in transparency, candor, and respect
Own the Solution - Be a problem solver. Embrace the challenge
Run in Our Customers' Shoes - Have empathy for our customers and evaluate our performance through their eyes

Who You Are

We understand that no candidate is perfectly qualified for any job. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your résumé is a clear demonstration of dedication, impact, and the ability to thrive in a fluid and collaborative environment. We want you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is close to what we're looking for. We also know that diversity of background and thought makes for better problem solving and more creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team.

This position is ideal first or second job for a bootcamp graduate that has shown they have what it takes to learn and grow and has decided to pursue their software development dream with a role in frontend/UX development.

You are comfortable working with more than one frontend technology and want to learn more
You have strong problem solving, debugging and investigative skills
You analyze and plan before you act
You own the solution from end to end
You have excellent communication skills
You take pride in developing clean, elegant and highly-reusable code that is easy to maintain and extend

Skills & Qualifications

You have a BS degree or equivalent, not necessarily in Computer Science
You may have learned a lot in Bootcamp but want to learn more
You have some frontend development experience with jQuery, Bootstrap or similar frameworks
You can turn wireframe mockups into front-end code
You can build hi-fidelity HTML prototypes using your experience in HTML, CSS and JavaScript

What You'll Do

Collaborate with peers on brainstorms, technical design discussions, pair programming sessions and code reviews
Solve problems and deliver products and solutions that help fulfill the Stack Sports vision
Build out frontend designs with technical and graphical flair

What We Offer

Open, modern, and collaborative work environment
Entrepreneurial environment - leave your mark
Purpose-driven culture
Comprehensive benefit package
Fully Paid Parental Leave

Accelerate Your Career

Drive global technology

With more than $2 billion in revenues, CDK Global is a leading global provider of integrated information technology and digital marketing solutions to the automotive retail and adjacent industries. Focused on enabling end-to-end automotive commerce, CDK provides solutions to dealers in more than 100 countries around the world, serving approximately 28,000 retail locations and most automotive manufacturers. CDK Global solutions automate and integrate critical processes from pre-sale targeted advertising to the sale, financing, insurance, parts supply, repair and maintenance of vehicles, with an increasing focus on utilizing data analytics and predictive intelligence.

We’re large enough to make a difference but small enough for your voice to be heard. This means that we are an organization where every person matters. You can make an impact on the success of our business and that of our customers regardless of what career you decide to pursue.

From data scientists to sales and client service experts, we’re hiring to support your growth and ours - Green light your career.

CDK Global Stability meets Agility. CDK is the largest technology provider to the automotive industry, with more than 26,000 dealer sites in over 100 countries and nearly 9,000 employees worldwide. We’re hiring to support your growth and ours.

CDK Global works with a broad variety of technologies, so your Java, .Net, C#, C++, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 or other technology interests and skills may work well with us. We build software that is used by consumers to shop for cars, as well as the systems used by about two-thirds of the dealers in the US to take care of their customers and their interface with the manufacturers. The CDK Global Engineering team is a group of fun, pragmatic, full-stack engineers with multi-language coding skills focused on engineering excellence and continuous improvement.

The most important thing to us about you is that you have a passion for working on cool stuff. And can work well with cool people. We love the energy shown in your projects (and those side projects you do, ‘just for you’). And we love that you can get in a room with amazing developers and learn and teach and contribute and grow. Full Job Description
TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance.

TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR.

JOB SUMMARY:
As the Security Operational system Analyst Intern you assist in building reporting capabilities for security events and key performance indicators.

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Work closely with security operations and vulnerability management team to analyze and develop reporting capabilities
  • Providing a user-centric experience when working with and solving problems.
  • Working and communicating in a creative and collaborative team environment.
  • Supporting and solving user needs with a hands-on approach, and tenacious integrity, passion and professionalism.
  • Organizing workflows to increase efficiency and efficacy.
  • Requesting, receiving, providing, and acting upon feedback.
  • Tapping into your passion for new technologies by exploring various tech solutions for challenges.
  • Evaluating, prioritizing and answering incoming support requests.
  • Demonstrating an ability to be self-motivated and highly organized
  • Supporting the needs of the business during occasional evening events.
  • Driving to continue to learn and grow throughout your career—technically, personally, and professionally
  • Knowledge of API concepts
  • Tableau reporting tools
JOB REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS:
Education:
  • Junior or senior undergrad or graduate students with a declared major in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or other related field
  • Minimum 3.0 GPA in core major classes
Experience:
  • Previous relevant internship/work experience preferred
  • Academic leadership or extra-curricular activity involvement preferred
  • Hands-on experience with requirements analysis, solution design, and/or project management preferred
Other Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
  • Demonstrated ability to understand objectives and requirements and convert them into solution designs and/or project plans strongly desired
  • Thrive in fast-paced environments, flexible and able to roll with changing business and technology environments
  • Strong analytical skills with attention to detail
  • Problem solver with intellectual curiosity to surface insights & implications and use this knowledge to think creatively about solutions
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong collaboration skills, works well in a team environment where team members may be distributed (not co-located).
  • High level of self-motivation: volunteer readily, undertake self-development activities, seek increased responsibilities, takes independent actions and calculated risks
  • Ability to manage multiple, concurrent work streams and tasks
Technical Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:
Beginner to intermediate knowledge of some of the following (not all required):
  • Object-Oriented analysis and design skills from a customer-in vantage point
  • Experience with multiple Software Development Lifecycle methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, etc.)
  • Agile (Scrum) project methodologies and development practices, particularly sprint planning and assessment, and test-driven development and continuous integration
  • Force.com, APEX, VisualForce, Workflows, OBM,
  • Integration/EAI technologies (e.g. Mulesoft, Pervasive, Informatica, Jitterbit, ESB, etc.),
  • Java, JavaScript, ASP,C++Java/J2EE, including SOAP, RESTful, .NET and related technologies (JSON, XML, etc)
  • Common frameworks such as struts, spring, hibernate, etc. and database technologies (Oracle, MySQL, JDBC, SQL, PL/SQL, stored procedures)
  • Experience using Salesforce data tools (e.g., Data Loader, DemandTools, Eclipse Force.com IDE).

Nearly half our technical staff holds a Ph.D. in Engineering, Mathematics, or the Physical Sciences. digital signal and image processing

Kalman filtering, tracker design and implementation
Statistics and probability theory
Linear algebra and matrix computations

must have experience using MATLAB
willingness to learn other languages as needed (C, C++, Julia, Python).

Detail oriented

Full Job Description
Join a team that is changing millions of lives.

Transforming smiles, changing lives

At Align Technology, we believe a great smile can transform a person’s life, so we create technology that gives people the confidence to take on whatever’s next. We revolutionized the orthodontic industry with the introduction of the Invisalign system, and we have never lost sight of that spirit of innovation. Our diverse and collaborative teams are constantly pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.

Ready to join us?

About this opportunity

Align is looking for a C++ Software Engineer Intern for our San Jose, CA office for a full-time position for a minimum of 8 weeks or until you have to go back to school. The C++ Software Engineer Intern will be working with Expert Engineers of the Biomechanical Software-Simulation team to document, test and validate some platform independent algorithms/applications currently used within company. This is a unique opportunity for a candidate wanting to get experience in a cutting edge development team.

In this role, you will…

Review and understand, with help from the team, Computational Geometry algorithms used within the company
Implement unit tests for such functionality
Document these algorithms and develop scripts to automatically generate webpages with documentation
Work efficiently in a fast-paced environment and meet critical deadlines
Multi-task and prioritize requests to meet the most important and urgent business needs
Work independently and under supervision of Software-Simulation team members
Deliver a final presentation to be shared with all cross-functional teams

In this role, you’ll need …

To be a recent graduate or currently pursuing a MS or PhD degree in computer science, biomedical engineering, or related technical field
Experience in software development (Strong object-oriented design skills)
Experience in a scripting language like Python
Ability to learn quickly and absorb various techniques and knowledge
Ability to work in a team environment

Sound like a good fit?

Great! Click the "Apply" link to let us know you are interested. Not the right fit? Don’t worry, Align is quickly growing so we are creating more opportunities to expand our Align family. Please consider joining our Talent Network to receive notifications about future jobs or sharing this opportunity with others in your network.

About Align

Align Technology is a publicly traded medical device company that is transforming smiles and changing lives. Our global team of talented employees develop innovative technology, tools and treatment options to help dental professionals worldwide achieve the clinical results they expect. Our digital ecosystem combines the power of technology to create beautiful smiles through the integration of AI and machine learning, digital imaging and visualization, biomechanics and material science to develop the Invisalign system, the most advanced clear aligner system in the world; iTero Intraoral Scanners and OrthoCAD digital services. Did you know? Align is the world’s largest manufacturer of custom 3D-printed materials.

By joining Align, you will be part of a global, fast-growing company in one of the most dynamic industries. Great people, innovative technologies, and meaningful work – these are just some of the things employees say make Align Technology a great place to work.

We respect your privacy. Please review our Applicant Privacy Policies for additional information.

Global Diversity Statement:
At Align, we believe in the power of a smile, and we know that every smile is as unique as our employees. As we grow, we will continue building a workforce of diverse cultural backgrounds and life experiences and fostering a culture of open-mindedness and compassion for all our employees. We live our company values by promoting healthy people and healthy communities. All with the intent of changing millions of lives, one unique smile at a time.

Equal Opportunity Statement

It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity in all of our employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category. Applicants for positions with Align must be legally authorized to work in the country which they are applying for and verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire.

Full Job Description
IT Hardware/Software Support Intern - IN PERSON at Downtown Cincinnati Office COVID-19 Safe Environment- Part-time 20 hours a week Summer 2021 Internship.

Burke, Inc. (www.burke.com), founded in 1931, is one of the world’s leading marketing research companies providing innovation and insights to many top Fortune 100-500 companies in all industries throughout the US. We are great at what we do! That's shown by our top client satisfaction ratings and continued growth. We are also a great place to work with the proof to back it up! Just ask anyone here. And, it's easily shown by our long tenures and just 5% turnover (after all, someone decides to retire occasionally!) Check us out!!

It’s never only about the work we do – Burke’s dynamic culture offers a well-rounded experience for you to grow and give back. You can join in with us as we partner with local organizations each year to give back to our community with ongoing gifts and volunteering roles. We also support and practice environmental sustainability, including our LEED® certified building and solar parking canopies. Have fun while at work with monthly planned onsite and offsite activities where employees interact, relax, and have fun together! Stay well through participating in any of our on-site fitness classes or checking out the corporate wellness programs. Thinking more about your career development? Help with input on your customized plan for ongoing development plans, and train and learn on the job and from others in your department too.

Our Network Services team is the group that runs all things computer, network, security, software, and related. They help the rest of us get our jobs done without a glitch! As an Intern in this group, you'll work in a small collaborative environment to provide quality technical support by working on hardware and software installations and roll-outs that support approximately 230 internal users. It's a great opportunity to train and grow your skills while applying what you already have learned in school and/or on other intern and co-op jobs.

What you’ll do:
Install, configure and maintain PCs and Mac computer equipment ensuring that all technology is ready for use.
Support various troubleshooting, network and system administration efforts with the rest of the team, and other technology-related projects within the department to help improve equipment and processes.
Burke's office is closed due to COVID-19 regulations and the safety of all employees. This position in Information Technology, however, is considered essential business to keep technology running for business to continue. There are only a few employees allowed in the office, and this is one. All are working at safe distances, and abiding to all federal and state regulations plus extra precautions we employ to keep you safe. This person must be in the office to perform this job.

What You’ll Need:
Associates or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field - in progress or newly complete.
A minimum of six months of experience in a similar role with technical support of hardware and software in a professional business environment.
Experienced with using and tech support on Dell laptop and desktop computers, Apple/ Macs, Windows 10, and Microsoft Office at a minimum.
MS Office Outlook, PowerPoint and Excel is preferred.
Knowledge of Windows Server, Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange, Microsoft SQL, Microsoft SCCM, McAfee, O365 Office 365, Cisco Call Manager, Cisco Unity, Cisco networking
Ability to communicate positively and professionally with all levels of the company

As part of our hiring process, Burke conducts a criminal background check on all potential employees. You may be asked to provide additional information for that purpose. (A conviction does not necessarily bar an applicant from employment.) Burke is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

position: SAP SuccessFactors iXp Intern - UI Engineer
description:
Full Job Description
Requisition ID:279784
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern
Career Level: NA

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP

Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

Welcome to the Human Revolution! Intern at a company that can accelerate your development, and potentially bootstrap your future career!

For every company, people are their most important asset. SAP SuccessFactors is the platform that empowers employees to perform at their best, and for businesses to streamline the way they handle HR. We’re a multi-tenant, SaaS-offerings company, automating HR-centric processes—encompassing the entire lifecycle of employee and business partner engagement. We have: 7000+ customers, 100+ million users, and peak daily transaction rates of 1 BILLION+ per day.

We are looking for talented interns who share in our vision to deliver continuous innovation in the cloud that makes our customers successful. Join our high-energy, high-output, creative colleagues who inspire and challenge each other towards excellence.

We have:
Best in the cloud-space HCM application, suited for Web and mobile devices.
Frameworks and a platform built with cutting edge technologies, which can be customized to customers’ extreme needs.
Flat hierarchy, Agile SCRUM environment with development responsibilities that span across all layers of the application.
Opportunities to explore different solutions, show the hacker side of you, and be part of a social cause.
A team of aces to work with.

What you’ll do:
Position title: SAP SuccessFactors iXp Intern – UI Engineer

Location: Palo Alto, California (Work From Home)

Expected start date to end date: June 10, 2021 – August 16, 2021

In this role, you’ll:
Re-implement one or more UIs for existing administration tools, to make them richer and more intuitive, using advanced JavaScript, HTML, and CSS in the implementation.
Create JavaScript unit and integration tests that can run in an automated fashion, as a part of an overall test-driven development approach.
Get hands-on experience with implementing UIs that support Right-to-Left languages and Web accessibility (using guidelines from ADA Section 508 and WCAG).

Who you are:
We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

Candidates to be currently enrolled in an undergraduate or master’s degree program that is applicable to the position (computer science or equivalent experience).
Strong programming skills in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
Experience using Web-based UI frameworks, such as jQuery, Angular, React, Vue, and OpenUI5.
Passionate about developing rich and intuitive UIs, and re-usable UI components.
Strong communication skills that include the ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions.
Preferred experience: written code using an object-oriented language such as Java, C++, or Objective-C / Swift; and used the command-line in Unix-based environments such as Linux and MacOS.

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Ready to join us?

About this opportunity

Align Technology, Inc. (the makers of Invisalign® aligners) is looking for 3D Software R&D Intern. The intern will work in the 3D Device Software Team, which is part of the R&D Product Innovation department. The position is for a full-time role with 10 weeks or until schools starts back up.

In this role, you will…

Work independently under supervision on one or more software projects and create a final presentation to share with the 3D Device Software Team and cross-functional teams. Activities may include:
Write MATLAB, Python, or C++ code to contribute to the orthodontic CAD product
Create SPLUNK dashboards and panels
Concept generation and iterative software prototyping
Formulating and testing hypotheses
Investigative research and root cause analysis
Participate in multiple stages of software Product Life Cycle
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as Biomechanical team and Materials team
Participate in project update meetings and effectively present data and findings
Assist with experiments, tests, documentation and organization of various projects
Assist with development of presentation materials including handouts, posters, graphs and PowerPoint presentations
Follow all departmental and company procedures as indicated in quality, administrative, or other systems
Comply with all safety policies, practices and procedures. Report all unsafe activities to supervisor and/or Human Resources.

In this role, you’ll need …

To be a student currently pursuing a Bachelor’s (junior or senior year), Master’s, or PhD degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or other STEM major
Experience with Python and/or MATLAB programming
Ability to read and understand existing code base, and improve the existing code and functionality
Good technical communication, documentation and presentation skills
Fast learner and good team player

Experience/Knowledge/Skills that are nice to have:
C++ programming
Familiarity with 3D geometry, algorithms and/or CAD software
Previous software R&D or internship experience

Sound like a good fit?

Great! Click the "Apply" link to let us know you are interested. Not the right fit? Don’t worry, Align is quickly growing so we are creating more opportunities to expand our Align family. Please consider joining our Talent Network to receive notifications about future jobs or sharing this opportunity with others in your network.

About Align

Align Technology is a publicly traded medical device company that is transforming smiles and changing lives. Our global team of talented employees develop innovative technology, tools and treatment options to help dental professionals worldwide achieve the clinical results they expect. Our digital ecosystem combines the power of technology to create beautiful smiles through the integration of AI and machine learning, digital imaging and visualization, biomechanics and material science to develop the Invisalign system, the most advanced clear aligner system in the world; iTero Intraoral Scanners and OrthoCAD digital services. Did you know? Align is the world’s largest manufacturer of custom 3D-printed materials.

By joining Align, you will be part of a global, fast-growing company in one of the most dynamic industries. Great people, innovative technologies, and meaningful work – these are just some of the things employees say make Align Technology a great place to work.

We respect your privacy. Please review our Applicant Privacy Policies for additional information.

Global Diversity Statement:
At Align, we believe in the power of a smile, and we know that every smile is as unique as our employees. As we grow, we will continue building a workforce of diverse cultural backgrounds and life experiences and fostering a culture of open-mindedness and compassion for all our employees. We live our company values by promoting healthy people and healthy communities. All with the intent of changing millions of lives, one unique smile at a time.

Equal Opportunity Statement

It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity in all of our employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category. Applicants for positions with Align must be legally authorized to work in the country which they are applying for and verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire.

Full Job Description
Requisition Number:
60561

Department:
Transportation Public Works

Transportation and Public Works Department is seeking a college student that is currently enrolled in an accredited college or university with major focus in Computer Science, Information Systems or other GIS related field such as Geographic Information Systems, Geography, Computer Science or Environmental Science. The TPW Business Support group maintains a GIS database with all TPW & Stormwater assets owned and maintained by the City.

Students will work approximately 20 hours a week.
The internship will not exceed 1 year.
Candidates should have at least 6-12 hours of classroom experience with GIS principles and practices in a classroom setting.
Experience with the ESRI suite of software products 10.x is preferred.
Knowledge of editing is preferred but not required.
A quality candidate should be self-motivated and able to multi-task between projects and achieve project deadlines. Applicants should have proficiency with basic GIS concepts for data review, editing and analysis. The capacity to learn new processes is critical, as well as having good verbal and written communication skills, and the ability to work well in a team environment.
The Geographic Information Systems (GIS)/Asset Management Team in the Transportation Public Works Business Support group is responsible for maintaining the GIS data for all infrastructure assets and the asset management system. This position will provide hands on work experience with seasoned GIS professionals, and offers an opportunity to put GIS knowledge from the classroom to practical use in the real world.
This position will afford candidates the opportunity to learn how GIS is utilized within a utility and municipality. This will be a paid internship position with flexible scheduling around classes. It is intended to provide a balanced work/school schedule and provide the candidate practical GIS experience in an innovative team centered environment.

The Impact You’ll Have

In this position you will be helping to identify and correct issues with data that support GIS in TPW & Stormwater. You will use critical thinking and problem solving skills to identify ways to update and maintain data efficiently. You will see the way that the integrity of this data drives various work activities within TPW & Stormwater.

Full Job Description
About the Position

The GIS Intern will provide temporary assistance to the Engineering Department with a variety of projects and tasks; including but not limited to field work, preparing and updating maps, accurately recording and documenting activities.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Including the following. Other duties, responsibilities, and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Support the District’s goal of making our customers our #1 advocates.
Assist Engineering Department in a variety of tasks associated with the District’s work.
Assist with data integrity and data maintenance as it relates to the District’s strategic initiatives.
Create and maintain accurate GIS records and documents.
Edit existing shapefiles, geodatabases, and relational databases.
Compile, manipulate and analyze data sets such as GIS locations of electrical facilities, outage events, work and asset management systems to support Engineering Department decisions and recommendations.
Field verify, acquire, download, correct, and document utility system information to prepare maps, drawings, etc. as directed.

Position Requirements

Position Requirements
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Supervisory Responsibilities:
This position has no supervisory responsibilities.

Education and/or Experience:
Must be enrolled in an accredited college program leading to an Associates or Bachelor’s of Science degree in engineering, computer science or Geographic Information Systems. ArcGIS, AutoCAD and system modeling tool or similar experience and/or coursework preferred.

Certificates, Licenses, or Registrations:
Must have a valid Driver’s license.

Computer Skills:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be proficient in MS Outlook, Excel, and Word. Experience in Geographic Information Systems software preferred.

Ability to type at least 45 words per minute.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.

Physical Demands:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is frequently required to walk, climb stairs, bend, reach, uses hands to finger, handle, or feel, and sit for extended periods of time. Occasionally required to lift and carry up to 40 pounds. Required to speak and hear clearly when communicating over the telephone and in person.

Work Environment:
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Many of the job duties will be in an office environment. Must dress and present yourself in a way that promotes a positive image of the District and meets the District’s dress code policy. Prolonged computer related exposure. Able to sit/stand at a workstation and operate a keyboard for long periods of time. Must be able to work for extended periods of time in a seated or standing position. While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be exposed to outdoor environments. Outdoor settings include all types of property and site conditions including open spaces, timberlands, urban developments, flat and hilly terrain, building construction sites, and road rights-of-way.

Supplemental Information

Department: Engineering

Location: Chehalis
FLSA Status: Non-exempt
Union/Non-Union: Non-Union
Wages: $20.00/ Hour
Travel: Local travel up to 10%; Regular field work and possible attendance at public meetings or trainings.

Full Job Description
Guidepoint Qsight identifies, gathers, acquires and delivers high-value data that offers clients unparalleled quantitative insight into company and sector performance. With over a decade of experience in collecting and analyzing primary data on hard-to-access markets, Guidepoint Qsight offers clients some of the most differentiated and powerful data available.

The Quantitative Research Intern will help with the development of Guidepoint's Qsight offerings including building new products from proprietary and purchased data.

Responsibilities:
Work with qualitative and quantitative data to find statistically significant signals and derive differentiated market insights
Research various sector and company controversies to help qualitatively inform and interpret models
Work with raw data to develop product categorization system relevant to medical device companies
Analyze and understand the disparate sources of healthcare industry data
Utilize a diverse array of technologies and tools as needed, to deliver insights, such as Python, R, SAS, SQL, Tableau

Qualifications:
Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Econometrics, or related fields, graduating by May 2021.
Must have a passion for solving complex big data problems and willingness to learn new technologies and tools
Ability to work efficiently with team members to assess needs, provide assistance, and think critically
Strong verbal/written communication skills to non-technical audiences
Excellent problem solver willing to work independently
Strong focus on quality and on addressing client needs

What We Have:
Competitive compensation
Free snacks and beverages
Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents
401(k) match, life insurance, commuter benefits, corporate gym rates, paid time-off and parental leave plans
Friday happy hour and "Summer Fridays"
Year-round corporate athletic league

At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired.

Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

Wells Fargo Technology sets IT strategy; enhances the design, development, and operations of our systems; optimizes the Wells Fargo infrastructure; provides information security; and enables Wells Fargo global customers to have 24 hours a day, 7 days a week banking access through in-branch, online, ATMs, and other channels.

Our mission is to deliver stable, secure, scalable, and innovative services at speeds that delight and satisfy our customers and unleash the skills potential of our employees.

The Wells Fargo Strategic Services & Advanced Technology (SSAT) group is a thought leader and driving force in the exploration and adoption of advanced and emerging technologies both within the Enterprise and the financial industry.

Within SSAT, the Advanced Technology Team focuses on identification, exploration, and delivery of enabling emerging and advanced technologies; discovering, evaluating, and inspiring new intellectual property and patent content; as well as, consultancy and collaboration via very broad engagement model across the enterprise.

We do this by performing extensive research and development, engaging with a landscape of elite academic and industry entities, and collaborating with a robust community of subject matter experts that lead to the implementation of revolutionary and innovative products and services in support of Wells Fargo's strategic goals. We keep a pulse on technical areas and connect the dots to other technologies while we envision and design the future years ahead.

Our major areas of focus are:
Quantum Technology
Decentralized Financial Technology
Digital Identity
Knowledge Graph
Digital Asset Management
Extended Reality
RegTech

Output from these areas result in:
Thought leadership and strategic direction
Proof of Technology design and execution
Intellectual property and technical papers
Patents
Architectural designs
Engineering patterns
Presentations and Education

The Wells Fargo Advanced Technology Internship provides participants with a ten-week experience with the Wells Fargo Advanced Technology Team and various other Technology groups within our organization with whom we partner. The experience includes research, intellectual property development, relevant and practical work assignments (proofs of concepts, use case definition, business case development, etc.), real-world training, group projects, and exposure to key leaders. It is designed to provide Masters and/or PhD students with a blend of business, technical, and personal developmental training. The Advanced Technology Internship targets exceptional Masters and/or PhD students.

In addition to participating in the Wells Fargo Corporate Intern Program virtual learning series, our interns have the opportunity to understand the day-to-day responsibilities of a team member and gain comprehensive professional and industry experience. The program exposes interns to a variety of business groups, providing a firm understanding of the company's operations, business strategies, and corporate culture.

Internship Duration: 10 Weeks during the summer June-August 2021

Key Locations (all virtual at this time)

Chandler, Arizona
Charlotte, North Carolina
Raleigh, North Carolina
Dallas, Texas
Des Moines, Iowa
Minneapolis, Minnesota
New York City, New York
St. Louis, Missouri
North Brunswick, New Jersey
Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
San Francisco, California

Placement

With the Wells Fargo Technology Internship, you will gain comprehensive professional and industry experience and be hired into the Advanced Technology team within the Strategic Services and Advanced Technology (SSAT) group and work with a number of our partners within the Enterprise, including:

Business Innovation & Technology Teams
Digital Innovation Technology Teams
Security Architecture and Engineering Teams
Innovation Research & Development Teams
Data Strategy and Analytics Teams
Risk and Controls Teams

Responsibilities

Key technologies and types of roles an Intern may be placed into:

Quantum Computing – algorithm development, libraries and packages, gate-based and annealer programming, advanced mathematics, practical use case development, QML.
Quantum Security/Post-Quantum Cryptograph – QKD, quantum-resistant algorithms, QRNG, fraud detection, advanced authentication models and systems, data visualizations.
Blockchain/DLT – constructs & use cases
Knowledge Graph Technology – graph databases, AI/ML, NLP.

*** Those considered for Wells Fargo Technology Internships must be currently pursuing a Masters degree and/or a PhD in a STEM related field such as mathematics, quantum computing/information systems, computer science, cryptography/security, data science, etc. with a graduation date between December 2021- June 2024. Candidates for these roles must be strong verbal and written communicators as they often act as a liaison between business and technology teams during projects.***

Wells Fargo will only consider candidates who are presently authorized to work for any employer in the United States and who will not require work visa sponsorship from Wells Fargo now or in the future in order to retain their authorization to work in the United States.

Desired Qualifications

Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities
Ability to prioritize work, meet deadlines, achieve goals, and work under pressure in a dynamic and complex environment
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Strong analytical skills and ability to solve complex technical problems

Other Desired Qualifications

Strong creative and ideation abilities with a desire to think 'out-of-the-box'
Intermediate Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, Visio, and PowerPoint) skills
Currently pursuing a Masters degree and/or a PhD in STEM related-field with a graduation date between December 2021-June 2024
Ability to learn from, and interact with, a diverse set of team members in a fast paced, fun and dynamic environment
A desire to learn and grow your portfolio of various businesses and technologies

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP
Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

Project management
Expand your network into different board areas and teams

We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

Current student or recent graduate of a Bachelor's, Master's or MBA degree program
Field of study: Engineering, Computer Science, MBA
Computer skills: Microsoft Office

Soft skills:
Desire to always be learning
Collaborative team-player attitude
Reliability and focus on high quality of work
Ability to work in a global, agile and diverse organization

First experiences and knowledge in process management would be beneficial
Practical experiences on IT/ business processes (like ITIL) gained through other IT internships would be an asset

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

Full Job Description
About our group:
The Product Management group in Seagate Technology in our Shakopee facility is looking for an intern to help define future digital storage requirements and storage related trends in the Enterprise Storage market.

About the role - you will:
The internship will spend some time (10-25%) in the lab learning how to setup and measure performance and power and manage storage products in a small-scale lab environment. Much of the time, you will be researching storage architectures and concatenating a summary of our OEM Enterprise storage customer platforms (current and future). Online research and meeting with internal storage architects will be necessary and results will be presented to internal PLM team. Opportunity for attendance at customer meetings and other industry forums may exist, including storage subsystem standards meetings (like Open Compute Project).

About you:
Student pursuing a BS degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Electrical Engineering

Basic knowledge of computer hardware architecture and interface technology is a must.

Location:
Our Shakopee campus is located 25 minutes southwest of Minneapolis in a setting with a rural vibe – it overlooks a horse racing track and stables, yet it has great entertainment venues close by as well. With wide-open spaces, the campus has plenty of space for running, biking, shooting some hoops or playing volleyball over lunch. If working out is your thing, the on-site fully equipped fitness center hosts wellness programs, tournaments and group workouts. Hungry? Seagate offers an on-site café with freshly sourced foods and specialty coffees, or if you prefer, drive to one of many restaurants just minutes away.

This is an extremely dynamic position and a great opportunity for an entry level marketing person to build their skills and their career. Reporting to the E-com General Manager, while working closely with the entire Marketing and design team. The ideal candidate is analytical and good with numbers and is driven to succeed with little supervision. You are someone who works well in a team and takes pride in helping a company succeed and grow and are willing to put in the work needed to become a valued member of an evolving marketing team.

Part time or Full-time position

  • We work hard and you work hard - You're excited about this because you know that you're getting twice as much experience as many of your peers.
  • Drive. Lots of it. You want to run the world one day, and that impresses us.
  • Exceptional eye for detail
  • Possesses the interpersonal skills needed to work effectively throughout the organization as well as with brand partners and vendors
  • Possesses the time management skills and focus to work independently remotely
  • Possesses the energy, ambition, as well as the desire to succeed and learn that are needed in a growing entrepreneurial environment

1. Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
2. Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
3. Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

SMB Presales at SAP Concur is an organization full of highly talented and passionate individuals that love sharing their subject matter expertise with prospects and customers. We uphold culture, diversity/inclusion, customer focus, and high performance as key attributes of our success. Learn alongside top talent in US, Canada, and UK markets on what a career in Presales looks like. Visibility to all sales, marketing, and product marketing functions are also a portion of the learning experience provided in this internship. This is a great opportunity to provide orientation of the SaaS industry and SAP Concur delivery model.
Presales represents many of the components that make up a successful SaaS business -> Sales Business + Software Business + Technology + Implementation.
SMB Presales supports the sales motion with small to medium businesses globally with 1,000 or less employees. SAP Concur provides intelligent spend management solutions supporting corporate travel, expenses, and accounts payable needs.

What you’ll do:
Position title: SAP Concur iXp Intern- SMB Presales
Location: Remote
Expected start date to end date: May 2021 – August 2021

In this role, you’ll:
…be working for SAP Concur’s Small and Medium Business Distribution Team, where you will be learning on-the-job by remotely supporting US Sales and Presales in a diverse number of ways, ranging from primary creative activities like storytelling, video editing & production, whiteboard animations to secondary activities like doing customer research. This will give you the opportunity to learn how a world-class and industry-recognized distribution team delivers value to our customers while gaining a tremendous commercial sense. You will work in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment. Additionally, you will be able to:
  • Perform data analysis work on our invoice consulting activities from the first half of this year and help identify trends in the types of opportunities, engagement models, the success of engagements, and where there are opportunities to increase exposure.
  • Assistance researching, creating and maintaining our value model supporting our business cases.
  • Generation of Top 25 followed by managing Monday Review Sessions.
  • Managing a component of Presales Boost Reporting Framework generation and distribution providing wonderful insights into how a business can be measured, incented, and executed.
  • Generation of data and support for Power BI Analytics and dashboards measuring the success of Digital Presales program.
Who you are:
We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stays curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

Business:
  • University/college student with a Computer Science, Information Technology, Economics or Business Studies degree qualification
  • Good understanding of IT market and trends
  • Appreciation of technology, internet/web applications, and desktop/office automation software
  • Strong interest in sales acumen and technical selling skills
  • Creative mind and storytelling skills
  • Attention to detail
  • Demonstrable video editing ability a plus
  • Experience with digital technology and editing software packages and video distribution platforms (e.g. Photoshop, After Effects, Final Cut, Motion, Adobe Premiere, Camtasia, Videolicious, Kaltura) also a plus
Non-Technical:
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills
  • Good interpersonal skills
  • Self-confident and a self-starter
  • Ability to work in virtual teams – To get a specific job done often requires working together with many colleagues spread out in different countries
  • Results in orientation and focus on quality
  • Most important is an eagerness to learn!
WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Additional Locations: Virtual - USA

Full Job Description

CT Advanced Algorithm Scientist (Intern)

Vernon Hills (Chicago), IL

www.research.us.medical.canon

CANON MEDICAL RESEARCH USA, INC.

is currently hiring for our ADVANCE Internship Program

Canon Medical Research USA, Inc. (CMRU) is proud to announce the launch of our 2021 ADVANCE internship program. Students will contribute at the forefront of innovation in medical imaging working alongside leading scientists and engineers as we develop and deliver the latest technology to our parent company Canon Medical Systems Corporation.

The ADVANCE Program is a structured program with goals and expectations designed to provide students with an opportunity to gain hands-on work experience by participating in significant work projects. Students will take on assignments throughout the term related to CMRU project needs depending on their skills and interests. The goal of these activities is to make important contributions to CMRU programs while at the same time significantly advancing the student’s professional and personal development. The program runs either 12 weeks during the summer term or 26 weeks during the summer and fall terms. This is a full-time, 37.5 hours a week, paid internship.

SUMMARY OF POSITION

CMRU is looking for two qualified interns to join our Computer Tomography (CT) research department where the students will participate in exciting projects using latest technology for medical imaging. Students will be mentored by leading experts in the field to gain hands-on experience to develop and validate products, explore the full potential for various clinical applications and features, and contribute to the next generation of CT systems. It offers a great opportunity to see how your research ideas can come to life and make a difference in countries around the world.

RESPONSIBILITIES

· Develop advanced algorithms to improve current image quality and workflow.

· Design and develop advanced algorithm for next generation products.

· Improve physical corrections in CT reconstruction.

· Work on image quality evaluation with other group members.

· Summarize work in the form of reports and presentations.

QUALIFICATIONS

Education

The ideal candidate is a full-time graduate student at an accredited college or university working towards a M.S. or Ph.D. in Biomedical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Medical Physics, Physics or related field in STEM.

Experience & Key Competencies

· Strong background in machine learning, image analysis, computer vision, signal processing and image processing.

· Experience in tomographic reconstruction, medical imaging, data correction or other imaging-related fields is preferred.

· Experience in Artificial Intelligence and Deep Learning is preferred. Hands on experience in CNN/DCNN network training is a plus.

· Knowledge of CT clinical applications and anatomy is a plus.

· Strong analytical and programming (C/C++/ Python/ MATLAB, etc) skills

Time Commitment

These two positions are full-time, temporary positions that require a commitment of 12 weeks (Term 1: Summer) or 26 weeks (Term 2: Summer and Fall) and 37.5 hours per week, Monday-Friday onsite during regular business hours. The term can be adjusted somewhat to accommodate the academic calendar on an as needed basis.

Requirements

· Students must be working towards a M.S. or Ph.D.

· Student must have taken several related courses in the field in which they will be assigned.

· Students must be at least 18 years of age.

· Students must be eligible to work in the U.S.

· Students are responsible to secure their own housing. CMRU will provide a few housing options located nearby our offices.

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: $20.00 - $35.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

Experience:

  • Research Experience: 1 year (Preferred)

  • Pay

Company's website:

  • www.research.us.medical.canon

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19
