Full Job Description
About the Role:
Passport has exciting news! We will have a paid internship opportunity in our Engineering Department to provide valuable insight into our fast-growing technology company. This 10 week program from June to August 2021 will be structured in a way to learn from various tech leaders and contribute value through project work and cross-team collaboration.

Interns should be prepared to work in a fast-paced team environment, learn, and aspire towards our Passport Principles and ethos. You will have the opportunity to build strong relationships across the organization to problem-solve as well as develop your business acumen within various departments. As a Software Engineer Intern at Passport, you’ll be paired with a Navigator, a peer on the Engineering Team who will help you get up to speed and guide you along your path.

Responsibilities:
Develop an understanding of how Passport performs and innovates within our industry
Contribute to building new features for our products on the frontend and backend
Debug code and fix defects
Document your work in a clear and concise manner
Gain an understanding of the many moving parts of a complex enterprise software platform
Continuously improve your coding skills while working alongside a talented and high performing engineering team
Understand and participate in our Agile development approach
Create and deliver a retrospective of your internship: accomplishments, learnings, and recommendations

About You:
You are creative, resourceful and passionate about not only continually learning but also providing value back to your team. You are detail-oriented, organized, and nothing slips through the cracks when you’re working on a project. You know how to work with others, and champion teamwork. You are resilient, and you learn from adversity. You have the ability to work as part of a dynamic team while demonstrating flexibility, autonomy, and initiative. You’re not afraid to roll your sleeves up and get your hands dirty with the details. Above all else, you are a confident communicator, and eager to learn and grow.

Qualifications:
Undergraduate or Graduate student, preferably with a major in Computer Science related field
Knowledge of 1 or more of the major programming languages, Python or Javascript is preferred
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Knowledge of various business platforms and software is a plus
G-Suite product experience is a plus

About Us:
Passport sets cities in motion, helping to create more livable, equitable communities. Based in Charlotte, North Carolina, Passport is a transportation software company, delivering the operating system that enables cities to manage vehicle interactions with streets and sidewalks. With Passport, city leaders increase convenience, efficiency and compliance today and tomorrow. Trusted by more than 1,200 cities, universities and agencies, including Chicago, Toronto, Los Angeles, and Miami, Passport is one of the fastest-growing companies on the Inc. 5000 and Deloitte Technology Fast 500 lists, and was named to Fast Company’s World’s Most Innovative Companies for 2020.

Passport is backed by a group of investors, including Bain Capital Ventures, Grotech Ventures, MK Capital and Relevance Media.

Passport provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

Full Job Description
Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!

Role:
Splunk is looking for highly motivated college students to join our team. As an intern, you will work on a real project (or a few) and have an opportunity to enjoy our dynamic, startup-like environment.

You will experience Splunking and what defines our culture while honing the skills which separate our development teams from others. Working to support internal and external customer needs, you will collaborate with multi-functional teams, receive mentorship, and gain insight into our values-driven process. Our goal is both to support your growth and development while empowering you for a successful start to your career.

Responsibilities:
As a Site Reliability Engineer Intern you will be responsible for …

Building innovative solutions for our next generation of our large-scale Cloud offering. You will get to work with a super smart bunch of folks who are working on robust, resilient, and auto-scaling platform solutions for hosting Splunk's enterprise software. The focus is always on automation, solving complex challenges that span across multiple groups within Splunk, ensuring smooth and expedient services to Splunk users. You will be working on the core compute platforms and hosting infrastructure within the Cloud.

You will design, develop, and test software systems
You'll actively contribute through participation in agile development of project timelines, implementation design specifications, system flow diagrams, documentation, testing, and ongoing support of systems
Your voice will have an impact through your recommended modifications to processes and procedures, and directly contribute to standard methodologies, architecture, and implementations
We will encourage you to live innovation by promoting and soliciting ideas within project teams

Requirements:
Possess knowledge of software engineering processes, agile framework, tools (e.g.: programming proficiency in a language, preferably Go, C++, Java, Python, etc), methods, test development, algorithms and data structure
Experience in systems programming (network stack, file system, OS services) and networking (L2 vs. L3, network architecture, VLANs, etc)
Experience in scripting in/for a Linux or Unix environment.
You are passionate about learning new technical ecosystems and contributing to building and running distributed systems at scale in production
Interested in working with container deployment and orchestration technologies at scale with familiarity of the fundamentals to include service discovery, deployments, monitoring, scheduling, load balancing
Interested in identifying performance bottlenecks, identifying anomalous system behavior, and determining the root cause of incident
Eager to effectively work collaboratively across functions in a fast-paced environment
You are enthusiastic about making the many users of your product happier
You enjoy working well with others in a fast-paced environment
You enjoy working within an agile environment
Strong communication skills, verbal and written
You bring enthusiasm for solving interesting problems

Preferred skills:
Knowledge of Kubernetes and Docker
Experience with development and deployment in a hosted cloud environment, preferably AWS

Education:
Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics or a related technical field, and strong record of academic achievement.

What We Offer You:
The opportunity to work with a set of extraordinarily talented and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering and QA to product management and customer support. Splunk flourishes with disruption and diversity
A constant stream of new things for you to learn and an opportunity for growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation.
A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment

We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Full Job Description
LiveRamp is the leading data connectivity platform. We are committed to connecting the world's data safely and effectively, advancing innovation, and empowering people to do good. Our platform powers customer experiences centered around the needs and concerns of real people, keeping the Internet open for all. We enable individuals around the world to connect with the brands and products they love. LiveRampers thrive on solving challenging problems for the good of humanity—and we're always looking for smart, kind, and creative people to help us get there.

Mission: LiveRamp makes it safe and easy for businesses to use data effectively.

Bring your coding and problem-solving skills without the syntax-checking! We help LiveRamp scale efficiently by automating manual processes using no-code tools. As part of our Identity and Access team you'll automate processes for our employees and help secure the company's valuable assets.

You will:
Build workflow automation using a no-code or low-code tool and its API integrations
Analyse requirements for understanding and feasibility
Document workflows you built
Propose enhancements to existing flows
Monitor and troubleshoot automations as needed

Your team will:
Support the company's growth by automating processes to on-board new hires (including interns like you!) and security off-boarding people leaving the company. In addition, the team will grant proper access so employees can do their work without friction.

About you:
You understand and break apart a manual business processes and turn them into an elegant set of repeatable coded steps
You diagram and document business workflows
You configure and administer the tool's API integrations if needed
You imagine the possible by assessing known capabilities
You challenge the status quo and preconceived limitations of tools, processes, and capabilities
You're pursuing BA/BS degree in Computer Science/Math or equivalent practical experience

Bonus Points:
Experience building apps on the Slack platform or similar collaboration applications
Expertise in fundamental API integrations, functions, data models & architectural design
Passionate about converting pain points into solutions

Benefits:
People: work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.
In-Office Food: enjoy catered meals, boundless snacks, and the occasional food truck.
Fun: we host in-person and virtual events such as game nights, happy hours, camping trips, and sports leagues.
Work/Life Harmony: flexible paid time off, options for working from home, and paid parental leave.
Whole Health Package: medical, dental, vision, and disability insurance. Plus mental health support (via Talkspace) and fitness reimbursement up to $100 per month.
Savings: our 401K matching plan helps you plan ahead.
RampRemote: a comprehensive program to assist you in setting up a home office that works for you

More about us:
LiveRamp's mission is to connect data in ways that matter, and doing so starts with our people. We know that inspired teams enlist people from a blend of backgrounds and experiences. And we know that individuals do their best when they not only bring their full selves to work but feel like they truly belong. Connecting LiveRampers to new ideas and one another is one of our guiding principles—one that informs how we hire, train, and grow our global team across nine countries and four continents.

LiveRamp is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer (AA/EOE/W/M/Vet/Disabled) and does not discriminate in recruiting, hiring, training, promotion or other employment of associates or the awarding of subcontracts because of a person's race, color, sex, age, religion, national origin, protected veteran, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetics or other protected status. Qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for the position in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
California residents: Please see our California Personnel Privacy Policy for more information regarding how we collect, use, and disclose the personal information you provide during the job application process.

To all recruitment agencies: LiveRamp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, LiveRamp employees or any other company location. LiveRamp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Full Job Description
**Note: Unfortunately, Summer Internships at LendingTree are not open to students who will require sponsorship now or at any point in the future. Thank you.

This position will likely work remotely the entire summer. However, our preference is to hire someone who will be based in the Chicago, IL area on the chance we're able to go back to office during the summer.

THE POSITION

Our former Summer Interns will tell you, LendingTree's Internship Program is selective, challenging and structured to push the limits of what they thought they could do - and they wouldn't have wanted it any other way. Are there easier ways to spend your summer? Absolutely. But a LendingTree Internship will help you grow professionally and also get you closer to landing a phenomenal job once you graduate – maybe even with LendingTree. Here's what you can expect:

Real work. The only person you'll be getting coffee for at LendingTree is yourself. You'll be doing professional level work that will have a real impact on the business
Training. Sure you'll learn a ton of industry skills as you contribute to your team every day, but you'll also go through specific training on: crafting a phenomenal resume and LinkedIn profile, getting interviews and how to handle them, how to give a great presentation and more
You're not alone. In addition from the support from your team you'll be assigned a Mentor outside of your department who will guide you and mentor you throughout the summer
End of summer presentation. At the end of the summer every Intern gives a PPT presentation to Executives which will include a summary of what you accomplished, what you learned and 2 ideas that will either make the company money or save the company money

RESPONSIBILITIES

Own a project – Analyze current customer experiences. Define, and run A/B tests and optimize consumer web-based product to specific metrics.
Monitor and analyze product performance and communicate findings and recommendations for meaningful changes. Define Product requirements for actionable changes and reiterate.
Put together wireframes to support product requirements and changes to be done.
Understand scope of the internal web-based product, participate in workshops. Own feature delivery, and write product requirements by working with business and development teams.
Communicate to partners on the progress of the feature/functionality.

QUALIFICATIONS

Undergrad or grad student (3.5+ GPA required) who will be graduating in Dec. 2021 or May 2022 (GPA must be listed on your resume to be considered).
Preferred majors: Business, Information Technology, Computer Science.
Proficient in Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs, etc.) and SQL
Good understanding of how APIs work.
Knowledge of Agile/Scrum product development or software development methodologies is preferred.
Willingness to roll up your sleeves and GET STUFF DONE.

COMPANY

LendingTree is the nation's largest online lending marketplace. That means we connect customers with multiple lenders so they find the best deals on loans, credit cards, savings accounts and insurance. Our goal is to help people save money, and we believe the best way to do that is by giving them a way to shop for loans and compare lenders so they make their best financial choices. Our CEO Doug Lebda founded the company in 1996 after a frustrating house-hunting experience. In those days, we mostly helped people find good mortgage deals. Now, we help consumers find their best in personal loans, auto loans, business loans, student loans, credit cards, savings accounts, home equity loans and more.

What else you should know:
We're a publicly-traded company (TREE).
We've welcomed several other companies into the LendingTree family to augment our efforts at helping borrowers make their most sensible financial choices.
We've built the LendingTree app and My LendingTree dashboard to give consumers tools to manage and monitor their financial health.
We still make funny commercials.

CULTURE

We're a fast-paced company with an entrepreneurial bend. We work hard and test our products often. We're collaborative, ambitious, candid and high-energy. Our teammates are some of the brightest, most talented people you'll ever work with. We care more about your smarts than we do about the kinds of clothes you wear (but please, do wear clothes to work!), and we're pretty good about rewarding innovation, creativity and the knack for just getting stuff done (we even have an award for employees called the GSD, "Get Stuff Done"). Come work with us!

LendingTree is the kind of company that not only promotes diversity and inclusion; we thrive because of these values. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion (or creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation or military status.

Full Job Description
The SRE Tools Team builds and maintains software that contributes to Addepar's business success inside of our product infrastructure, and to make that software available for other users who wish to use and operate it.

We're looking for highly motivated, detail-oriented individuals to assist us in delivering industry-disrupting infrastructure automation. You'll help validate tool specifications, test infrastructure automation software before it is released, and work with the infrastructure supporting the Addepar product.

Intern Program Dates: May 24 - Aug 13, 2021

Role Overview

Involved throughout the SRE Tools team development lifecycle with particular responsibility testing, writing test tooling. In essence you will be writing software to test software.
Work closely with the SRE Team to enhance and improve features in our infrastructure automation tooling.
Work closely with internal customers, other Addepar Engineering, Security, and SRE teams, to integrate and use new tools.
You will learn and experience all aspects of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), and work with cloud infrastructure in a real life environment.

Key Responsibilities

Working closely with SRE Tools to build integration test tooling, as well as working in the codebases to identify and improve unit test coverage.
Working closely with SRE to identify feature and design gaps in emerging Alpha/Beta grade software.

Knowledge, Skills & Experience Required

Working towards a BS or MS degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a similar discipline or an equivalent amount of real-life experience
Basic UNIX use.
Experience with Python required, (SRE Tools uses Python3 and boto, for AWS)
Experience or Interest in standards-based network, internet, and computing infrastructure.
Experience or Interest in security principles applied to infrastructure design and implementation.

Addepar is a wealth management platform that specializes in data aggregation, analytics and reporting for even the most complex investment portfolios. Founded in 2009 by Joe Lonsdale, who currently serves as an active Chairman of its Board of Directors and General Partner at 8VC, the company's platform aggregates portfolio, market and client data all in one place. It provides asset owners and advisors a clearer financial picture at every level, allowing them to make more informed and timely investment decisions. Addepar works with hundreds of leading financial advisors, family offices and large financial institutions that manage data for over $2 trillion of assets on the company's platform. In 2020, Addepar was named as a Forbes Fintech 50 company and honored as a member of the CB Insights Fintech 250. Addepar is headquartered in Silicon Valley and has offices in New York City and Salt Lake City. All brokerage services offered through Acervus Securities Inc., member FINRA / SIPC.

Addepar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We seek to bring together diverse ideas, experiences, skill sets, perspectives, backgrounds, and identities to drive innovative solutions. We commit to promoting a welcoming environment where inclusion and belonging are held as a shared responsibility.

In order to ensure the health and safety of all Addepeeps and our prospective candidates, we have instituted a virtual interview and onboarding experience.

Full Job Description
The Product Design team at Addepar is looking for a product design intern to come work with us and take part in transforming how financial advisors understand and communicate their clients' data. In an industry plagued by complicated software, Addepar is distinguished by a relentless pursuit of clean and simple user experiences.

As a full-time product design intern, you will be tasked to work on meaningful projects in user-facing areas and mentored by a product design lead in the product development lifecycle. You will participate in brainstorming sessions, stakeholder meetings, user research, and design production. Our cross-disciplinary environment will provide a unique opportunity to learn from designers, product managers, content strategists, and engineers to design impactful solutions to challenging problems from conception through validation. You will walk away with a completed portfolio piece and experience working in a fintech startup.

This paid internship will be a remote position during a 3 - 4 month period for Spring/Summer 2021 depending on your availability.

Intern Program Dates: May 24 - Aug 13, 2021

Responsibilities:
Research, design, and iterate on new features and improvements to our products and services.
Collaborate closely with product, content strategy, and engineering on requirements development, feature definition, and implementation.
Deliver design mocks, prototype, and assets.
Clearly articulate and document your design decisions and rationales.
Give and solicit feedback from other designers and cross-disciplinary partners.

Requirements:
Currently pursuing or recent graduate of a degree or intensive in design, human-computer interaction, computer science, or related field.
A solid portfolio demonstrating product thinking, visual, and interaction design work.
A passion for using data and user research to inform design decisions and solve problems that matter.
Strong, clean visual design sense.
Excellent communication skills (verbal, written, and visual).
Proficiency in design and prototyping tools (e.g. Sketch, Figma, etc.).

Addepar is a wealth management platform that specializes in data aggregation, analytics and reporting for even the most complex investment portfolios. Founded in 2009 by Joe Lonsdale, who currently serves as an active Chairman of its Board of Directors and General Partner at 8VC, the company's platform aggregates portfolio, market and client data all in one place. It provides asset owners and advisors a clearer financial picture at every level, allowing them to make more informed and timely investment decisions. Addepar works with hundreds of leading financial advisors, family offices and large financial institutions that manage data for over $2 trillion of assets on the company's platform. In 2020, Addepar was named as a Forbes Fintech 50 company and honored as a member of the CB Insights Fintech 250. Addepar is headquartered in Silicon Valley and has offices in New York City and Salt Lake City. All brokerage services offered through Acervus Securities Inc., member FINRA / SIPC.

Addepar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We seek to bring together diverse ideas, experiences, skill sets, perspectives, backgrounds, and identities to drive innovative solutions. We commit to promoting a welcoming environment where inclusion and belonging are held as a shared responsibility.

In order to ensure the health and safety of all Addepeeps and our prospective candidates, we have instituted a virtual interview and onboarding experience.

Full Job Description
Join us as we pursue our ground-breaking vision to make machine data accessible, usable, and valuable to everyone with Splunk’s Data-to-Everything platform. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers and partners. At Splunk, we are committed to our work, customers, having fun and, most importantly, to each other’s success.

As a Program Developer Intern in Field Product Management, you will be responsible for auditing data and developing tools that support Splunk Ideas, our Enhancement Request platform for the Entire Splunk Portfolio. Splunk Ideas improves customer satisfaction by amplifying our communities' voices and growing transparency into our feature development planning. Your contributions will ensure the integrity of the Ideas platform, and empower Product Managers and Leadership to make data-driven decisions that impact feature development, roadmap planning, resource allocation, and initiative alignment. You will audit a variety of data sources including multiple customer feedback channels and software and roadmap development products, improve analytic dashboards, and develop new visualizations that streamline Product Management workflows and enable our Field organizations to track and communicate feature delivery expectations to their accounts.

This role will be part of the Field Product Management team, which works closely with all Product Managers across the entire Splunk portfolio, and equips Field teams with resources to improve transparency into our planning and set appropriate customer expectations. Since its launch in early 2020, thousands of customers have contributed over 60,000 votes and 1,000 comments across 2700 requests for enhancement.

Responsibilities
Audit program data and develop monitoring alerts and dashboards to improve data quality and program availability.
Refactor and document existing SPL queries and XML dashboards to improve consistency and supportability.
Research & create new d3 visualizations and glass-table dashboards to improve user experience
Skills / Requirements
Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or relevant coursework/experience. Javascript development experience is a plus.
Strong project execution skills, attention to detail and quality.
Passion for UI/UX and interface design
Ability to convey ideas effectively, listen intently, write strong product requirements, and drive consensus across functions and teams
Ability to deal with ambiguity – given an open-ended task, you can seek out and read documentation and can deliver great work with minimal supervision
Self-motivated and collaborative

position: Low Level Software Engineer Intern - Fitness
description:
Full Job Description
Are you ready to work up a sweat? Our fitness team is looking for self-motivated, confident and passionate engineers to help us create products that solve complex problems and make people’s lives safer, healthier and more enjoyable. Our fitness technology provides a combination of performance, safety, quality, value, innovation and ease of operation to help our consumers get the most out of their workouts. We strive for continual innovation, resulting in high-quality, state-of-the-art products aimed at giving our consumers an unwavering level of confidence when they’re out running, biking, golfing or swimming. If fitness is your passion, we need to catch you!

We are looking for a full time Software Engineer Intern to develop embedded or application software for our products at our world headquarters in Olathe, KS. They will test software, perform software releases, quality assurance activities and performance maintenance activities on real Garmin products.

Essential functions and responsibilities in this role include:

New product design and development
Troubleshooting basic issue reports & implementing software solutions
Communicating status of work & providing visibility to supervisor
Learning how to use & apply various engineering tools as needed for the role
Planning technical work to meet team objectives
Applying design standards and procedures to implement basic designs
Thoroughly documenting work in an organized manner
Working collaboratively in a team environment to achieve individual & team goals

Qualified candidates for this role will have completed coursework in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a field relevant to perform the essential functions of this job description with a minimum cumulative GPA greater than or equal to 3.0.

Other requirements include:
Demonstrated strong and effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Must demonstrate relevant experience and/or training in a low, mid, or high-level language such as C, C++, or other selected languages
Must possess relevant experience and/or training in data structures or object-oriented design methodology relevant to Garmin’s business need
A cumulative GPA greater than or equal to 3.0 and previous experience working in a team environment is highly preferred!

Garmin Intern Perks:
Social activities and service opportunities planned for interns
Paid time off
Paid holidays
Test cutting-edge Garmin products before they are released
No formal dress code
Assigned mentor to answer your questions and help you grow in your technical skillsets
Associate discount on consumer products
Paid, coordinated housing or stipend option for interns whose permanent address is located more than 50 miles from Garmin HQ
Housing stipend option for those at field locations (non-Olathe) whose permanent address is located more than 50 miles from the field location
Waived registration fees for Garmin-approved races

As part of our ongoing commitment to helping associates maintain a healthy balance between work and life, we sponsor company-wide and individual wellness initiatives, as well as world-class sporting events—and even some of the participating athletes. In each of the communities in which we do business, Garmin has a strong philanthropic and civic presence.

Garmin International is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran’s status, age or disability.

Full Job Description

Showcase your passion in video games and join our team! We are a small, startup mobile gaming company, and we are looking to fill an available Intern position ASAP. For certain candidates, this can be used for school credit. All candidates will receive developer credit, and should use this opportunity to learn more about developing mobile products and game design.

We are excited about bringing someone on board to further develop our company's gaming services. This is the perfect opportunity for someone who is enthusiastic about working in a fast paced environment and who is on the hunt for exciting new challenges.

Ideally, you should be able to juggle really well (tasks/roles/ect), be able to showcase leadership, know all coding and design best practices, and look forward to future rewards as our company levels up from small startup status.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with our product and design leads to come up with a modern and creative website design.
  • Work on architecture design. This includes research related to the project and defining the correct technologies that should be used to accomplish project goals.
  • Lead a small team of developers by example. We don't want managers, we want leaders who can code efficiently and at the highest of level. That uses best coding practices by nature and are able to teach/train these best practices.
  • Notice and fix errors on the company website.
  • Help with code reviews and technical project management.
  • Work on finding solutions for both low level and high level problems.
  • Create technical documentation e.g. sequence diagrams, class diagrams, flow charts, ect.

Qualifications:

  • Recent college graduate with BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent program. OR current college student going to school for Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent program
  • Proficiency in one or more back-end languages/frameworks (e.g. PHP/Node.js/Python)
  • Proficiency in JavaScript programming and one or more JS frameworks (e.g. Angular)
  • Strong database design skills (SQL/NoSQL)
  • Experience with one or more cloud providers (e.g. Google Cloud)
  • Solid experience in system and software architecture
  • Good written and spoken English
  • Stable internet connection and home computer
  • Have a genuine and passionate interest in taking an idea from concept to creation

Our Culture:

We are a small company that is 3-6 months away from leveling up! Our team is made up of enthusiastic people looking to build high quality and fun videogames/game services. We are an ambitious, team-oriented group of people that are motivated by great design and the opportunity to provide fun and entertainment to the public.

Pros:

  • You get to have a flexible schedule and work remotely! You are required to work at least 30 hours/week, however, how you arrange your working hours is up to you. You will be given tasks that will need to be completed by set deadlines.
  • Great opportunity to boost your portfolio! You will receive a developer credit.
  • This is a great learning opportunity! If you have an interest in mobile development, web development and/or video games, this will be a good chance for you to develop the skills necessary to have success in these highly competitive industries.
  • Possible opportunity to receive school credit for works completed.
  • Once the company levels up, the sky is the limit regarding position/salary.

The Interview Process:
All interviews will be conducted online. We have no physical location for you to go to. The interview portion will be 1 hour long. You will be given a short homework assignment (non-coding) that should take 30 mins to complete.

Note: We do not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Service Agreement, we will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, we explicitly reserve the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency.

Job Type: Internship

Pay: $69,266.00 - $157,693.00 per year

Education:

  • Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

  • JavaScript: 1 year (Required)
  • Angular: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Internship Compensation:

  • College Credit

This Job Is:

  • A good fit for applicants with gaps in their resume, or who have been out of the workforce for the past 6 months or more
  • A job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to apply
  • Open to applicants who do not have a college diploma

Company's website:

  • https://tatumgames.com/

Company's Facebook page:

  • http://www.facebook.com/tatumgames

Benefit Conditions:

  • Waiting period may apply

COVID-19 Precaution(s):

  • Remote interview process
  • Virtual meetings

Full Job Description
Overview

A Design Technologist is a full stack developer who understands design. As a UX Engineer in the Design Technology group at Intuit you will advocate for content strategy, creative directions, and engineering complexities. We're looking for engineers who bring new ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, content engineering, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design, and mobile. We’re looking for our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems as we use technology to push design forward.

Our Team

The Intuit Futures team defines and delivers new platform capabilities and experiences that accelerate Intuit’s innovation and product delivery. By anticipating future customer needs and understanding external technology trends, our multi-disciplined team propels the next generation of customer experiences for Intuit’s flagship products through cutting edge technologies such as Advanced AI, Knowledge Graphs, Blockchain, and CUI. As a Product Manager intern, you’ll run experiments to test hypotheses with customers using lean startup techniques, complete market research and gather feature requirements for the development team.

What you'll bring
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Human-Computer interaction, Design, or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience. Graduating no earlier than December 2021
Strong sense of web design and attuned to the fundamentals of user experience, including author experience in content management systems.
A portfolio of professional creative work that demonstrates intuitive front end user interfaces.
Experience with the latest and greatest web standards, including HTML5 and CSS3.
Strong experience in modern JavaScript technologies, and one or more programming languages including but not limited to: Java, C/C++, Python or PHP.
Mastery of WordPress coding and security best practices.
Experience building, deploying, DevOps, and web security for applications on cloud technologies such as AWS
Familiarity with the whole web stack, including protocols and web server optimization techniques.
An understanding of the principles of accessibility and can build products that are accessible to users with disabilities
Excellent interpersonal communication skills and have a good attitude in a collaborative setting.
A positive attitude and a lack of ego
Quick learning tendencies and a self starter.
Experience working in a large corporate setting
Organized, self-directed, efficient and comfortable in multiple and complex projects.
AWS certification is a plus.
How you will lead
Knowledge of front-end design patterns and latest technology trends is a must.
You must have a strong point of view, backed up by personal expertise, design rationale, customer data, and industry trends.
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.
Strategize a path forward towards excellence based on findings and current problems.
Set up and maintain sites on environments such as AWS and WordPress
Contributes to QuickBooks and Intuit Design Systems
A solid understanding of programming fundamentals
A strong advocacy for UX, adept at UI implementation
Communicating the value provided to cross-functional partners
Building tools to improve the UX process

Full Job Description
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

The future is what you make it.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.

Are you ready to help us make the future?

Join a team that designs, develops and integrates highly complex software applications within Honeywell. You will be an active and integral member of a team to achieve the completion of goals. You will also generate innovative solutions in work situations; trying different and novel ways to deal with problems and opportunities.

Use your skill set to provide value added software features to our products for our customers.
Accelerate innovation and growth, teaming with the world's most talented engineers.

We invite you to discover for yourself why a career with Honeywell is the opportunity you've been looking for!

YOU MUST HAVE

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in Engineering or Computer Science
  • Must graduate after December 2021
  • Must continue enrollment in degree program upon completion of the internship
WE VALUE

  • Knowledgeable with JavaScript/TypeScript and NodeJS
  • Understanding various software development lifecycle
  • Demonstrate the ability to develop efficient and high-quality software
  • Knowledge of software configuration management and change management practices
  • Diverse and global teaming and collaboration
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Effective communicator
  • Can quickly analyze, incorporate and apply new information and concepts
  • Ability to consistently make timely decisions even in the face of complexity, balancing systematic analysis with decisiveness
  • Validated academic excellence (3.0 GPA and higher)
Additional Information
JOB ID: req242916
Category: Engineering
Location: 13560 Morris Road, Suite 3500, 3rd Floor,Alpharetta,Georgia,30004,United States
Nonexempt

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

Full Job Description
Your Contributions

As a Software Development Intern, you will work with our talented team of software engineers- while we support your growth in software development, and together deliver world class Human Capital Management (HCM) software products. At Asure, we work in nimble Agile teams, empowered to continuously create, test, and execute new product features and enhancements. We have multiple openings working on both legacy applications as well as greenfield projects. Preferred locations are (our dog friendly) offices in Tampa, Florida or Burlington, Vermont.

Our technology: Don’t worry. We don’t expect you to be a master at them: .NET core, React, C#, ASP.Net, SQL, RESTful APIs

Your Responsibilities

Leverage cutting-edge technologies and modern development practices.
Collaborate and learn from UX designers, product owners, and engineers through peer programming, code review, and technical presentations.
Contribute to building and shipping high-quality code at a rapid pace.
Keep up to date with emerging technologies and software development best practices.
Participate in scrum ceremonies including the daily stand up, backlog refinement, sprint planning, sprint retrospective and sprint reviews.

Your Qualifications- what you bring
We believe that we can always improve: So, we will expect you to:

Continuously learn modern software design and development core practices, utilizing articles, podcasts, etc.
Always having an open mind when reviewing and discussing code with team members to understand best practices and optimal design patterns.
Increase your business acumen by consistently learning about Asure’s product offerings.

Computer Science or related major of current study preferred.
Eligible to work in the US without sponsorship, as we are unable to sponsor or transfer Visas at this time.
Ability to work remotely
Have a curiosity and desire to navigate unknowns

Your Benefits- aka the good stuff

We think long term, so we want you to know that our Full Time Employees are eligible for:

Annual Bonus Opportunity
Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA, FSA- effective day 1
Basic Life, A+D, and STD
401K Program with matching
Fitness Reimbursement Program
Employee Stock Purchase Program
PTO
Company Comradery: President’s Circle Award, Team Building, Happy Hours, Charity Drives, and Team Lunches

Our Profile

More than 60,000 clients in 86 countries rely on Asure Software’s technology to elevate how, when, and where work gets done. Headquartered in Austin, Texas, Asure offers an amazing opportunity to take your talent to the next level. Our clients, small & medium-sized organizations as well as iconic Fortune and Global 100 enterprises, are able to attract and retain better talent, cut real estate and labor expense, and increase productivity with our unique solutions.

We are an equal opportunity employer. All candidates must be legally authorized to work in the US, as we are unable to sponsor or transfer Visas at this time. Criminal background checks conducted at employment offer.
qualifications: Eligible to work in the U.S

description:
Full Job Description
Scaled Agile’s summer internship program seeks to provide training and a platform for future success for those from diverse backgrounds that have traditionally been under-represented in technology businesses. Our interns will expand on their current studies and skills and learn how those skills apply in the workplace. They will get to work with team members who know how to use the SAFe Framework and to respond to changing dynamics in the workplace and market, delivering innovative solutions. Our interns will learn how to understand and promote the cadence and transparency of the SAFe approach in both their school and work life. They will be empowered to create a happier and more engaging work life.

Scaled Agile, Inc. is seeking a Data Science Intern who will support our Data Scientist in implementing data strategies. In this position you will gain visibility into the real-world aspects of business data operations in a marketing context, provide concrete deliverables, and will develop a working knowledge of how Lean and Agile practices are used in the data science field.

Your responsibilities will include some or all of the following:

Developing predictive algorithms for Salesforce (SFDC) data
Contributing to the strategy and recommendations for cleaning Salesforce data
Managing Marketo data tracking & reporting
Managing Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager for data tracking, conversion tracking, and analytics

Knowledge Requirements

Extensive knowledge of SFDC objects, Marketo and Google Analytics
Strong ETL skills and ability to work with structured and unstructured data
Deep understanding of descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics
Strong Python or R knowledge, preferably in developing logistic regression, decision trees, or K-means clustering
Develop strategies for automating data workflows (SFDC)

Successful candidates are:
Creative thinkers
Problem Solvers
Obsessed with details
Pursuing a Masters in Data Science or computer science

Work Location

The location of this position is flexible, but must be available to work in the Mountain Time Zone. Please note that all Scaled Agile staff and interns are currently working remotely during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Compensation

Scaled Agile is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. This is a paid internship paying $18-$25 per hour. Final compensation for this role will be determined by various factors such as a candidate's relevant work experience, skills, and certifications.

As a temporary internship position, this role is not eligible for the benefits package offered full-time employees.

position: Back End, Full Stack Engineering Intern
description:

position: Internship - Product Manager, Credit Cards - Summer 2021
description:
Full Job Description
**Note: Unfortunately, Summer Internships at LendingTree are not open to students who will require sponsorship now or at any point in the future. Thank you.

This position will likely work remotely the entire summer. However, our preference is to hire someone who will be based in the Charlotte, NC area on the chance we're able to go back to office during the summer.

THE POSITION

Our former Summer Interns will tell you, LendingTree's Internship Program is selective, challenging and structured to push the limits of what they thought they could do - and they wouldn't have wanted it any other way. Are there easier ways to spend your summer? Absolutely. But a LendingTree Internship will help you grow professionally and also get you closer to landing a phenomenal job once you graduate – maybe even with LendingTree. Here's what you can expect:

Real work. The only person you'll be getting coffee for at LendingTree is yourself. You'll be doing professional level work that will have a real impact on the business
Training. Sure you'll learn a ton of industry skills as you contribute to your team every day, but you'll also go through specific training on: crafting a phenomenal resume and LinkedIn profile, getting interviews and how to handle them, how to give a great presentation and more
You're not alone. In addition from the support from your team you'll be assigned a Mentor outside of your department who will guide you and mentor you throughout the summer
End of summer presentation. At the end of the summer every Intern gives a PPT presentation to Executives which will include a summary of what you accomplished, what you learned and 2 ideas that will either make the company money or save the company money

RESPONSIBILITIES

Own a project – Analyze current customer experiences. Define and run qualitative and quantitative customer research to inform the development of web-based products
Monitor and analyze product performance and communicate findings and recommendations for meaningful changes.
Define Product requirements for actionable changes and reiterate.
Put together wireframes to support product requirements and changes to be done.
Understand scope of the internal web-based product, participate in workshops. Own feature delivery, and write product requirements by working with business and development teams.
Communicate to partners on the progress of the feature/functionality.

QUALIFICATIONS

Undergrad or grad student (3.5+ GPA required) who will be graduating in Dec. 2021 or May 2022 (GPA must be listed on your resume to be considered).
Preferred majors: Business, Information Technology, Computer Science, Sociology, Psychology
Proficient in Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs, etc.) and SQL
Good understanding of customer research methods (qualitative, quantitative)
Knowledge of Agile/Scrum product development or software development methodologies is preferred.
Willingness to roll up your sleeves and GET STUFF DONE.

COMPANY

LendingTree is the nation's largest online lending marketplace. That means we connect customers with multiple lenders so they find the best deals on loans, credit cards, savings accounts and insurance. Our goal is to help people save money, and we believe the best way to do that is by giving them a way to shop for loans and compare lenders so they make their best financial choices. Our CEO Doug Lebda founded the company in 1996 after a frustrating house-hunting experience. In those days, we mostly helped people find good mortgage deals. Now, we help consumers find their best in personal loans, auto loans, business loans, student loans, credit cards, savings accounts, home equity loans and more.

What else you should know:
We're a publicly-traded company (TREE).
We've welcomed several other companies into the LendingTree family to augment our efforts at helping borrowers make their most sensible financial choices.
We've built the LendingTree app and My LendingTree dashboard to give consumers tools to manage and monitor their financial health.
We still make funny commercials.

CULTURE

We're a fast-paced company with an entrepreneurial bend. We work hard and test our products often. We're collaborative, ambitious, candid and high-energy. Our teammates are some of the brightest, most talented people you'll ever work with. We care more about your smarts than we do about the kinds of clothes you wear (but please, do wear clothes to work!), and we're pretty good about rewarding innovation, creativity and the knack for just getting stuff done (we even have an award for employees called the GSD, "Get Stuff Done"). Come work with us!

LendingTree is the kind of company that not only promotes diversity and inclusion; we thrive because of these values. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion (or creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation or military status.

Full Job Description
Marlette Funding is a consumer financial technology (fintech) business that offers consumers low-rate personal loans up to $50,000 through its Best Egg® brand.

Marlette has experienced tremendous growth since its inception in 2014, with over $10B in consumer loans originated. Today, we’ve grown to over 200 employees, enjoy strong employee engagement scores and have been recognized numerous times as a best workplace in the mid-sized and fintech categories.

Our goal is to create a positive workplace where our employees develop and thrive. To accomplish this we hire smart, highly driven people and frequently solicit their input and feedback to ensure that our culture and work environment meets their needs. Employees receive plenty of perks including competitive salary, bonuses, 401k match, generous PTO and holidays, a well-stocked kitchen (when we’re back in the office) and numerous fun events and charitable opportunities.

Marlette celebrates diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better we will grow.

Marlette Funding, provider of Best Egg online lending platform is growing at a fast rate in personal loan as well as new products launched into the fintech space. An internship with Best Egg will open the door to additional potential growth as we expand our team in future as well as training with some of the brightest machine learning data scientists in the industry. You will have decision science specific hands on experience which will pioneer your career growth substantially.

The Job
The Data Scientist team will be part of the Decision Science team and will help create innovative data-driven tools that are used to improve business decisions across the company.

Duties & Responsibilities
The primary responsibility of the Data Scientist intern will be to develop new machine learning algorithms and models to optimize marketing decisions. The intern will:
Create and optimize machine learning models to predict customer response and conversion.
Sift through thousands of attributes to determine which are most valuable.
Create and test new techniques, and algorithms that will improve capabilities across the Decision Science team.
Explore difficult new problems in the marketing space, addressing feedback loops and performance drift.
Requirements
Experience with Python (SQL preferred)
Familiarity with machine learning algorithms as well as data science frameworks such as scikit-learn
Working knowledge of statistics and data analysis
Preferred Education: Undergraduate or Graduate Level student, or recently graduated from a Graduate program pursuing a Master's Degree or PhD in Data Science, Statistics, Math, Computer Science, or related field
Leadership
Comfortable interacting and engaging with colleagues from all levels of management across all business units and external auditors.
Demonstrated technical leadership skills including self-direction, coaching and mentoring, getting buy-ins on the models from all relevant constituents.
High self-efficacy, highly motivated, well organized, capable of developing and executing a sprint plan, and able to communicate status effectively
Effectively collaborate remotely
Culture
Ability to succeed within a cross-functional team emphasizing Collective Ownership in a fast-paced environment
Be confident and willing to challenge status quo but also willing to concede and execute other’s ideas when necessary
Capable of teaching and learning from others to promote continuity of knowledge and personal development
Ability to work effectively independently and as a team member
Excellent English written and verbal communication skills
We are hiring for a Summer 2021 Intern - full-time hour availability, start date May - August (can be flexible).
Potential for longer term relationship or eventual full-time position.
100% remote okay (we are all remote right now due to covid) must be US based.

Our Brand:
At Best Egg, we believe money should be accessible so people can reach their goals, live a fuller life, and feel pride in knowing they have taken control of their finances. For those who need extra money to achieve the progress they seek in life, Best Egg is the modern solution-minded finance provider that mixes decades of banking experience with smart technology and deep customer insight to create products designed for today’s borrower, so that people can establish a smoother financial path. The egg symbolizes protection and a fresh start.

Looking for a way to stand out?
Send a follow up email to Talent Acquisition: savannah.scalyer@bestegg.com with your name and position of interest in the subject. In the email please include: Your resume attachment and a brief introduction highlighting what about this role stood out to you the most.

Recruiting Agencies: We appreciate what you do and understand how challenging it can be, however please do not send us unsolicited resumes or cold outreach to our employees, job listings or recruiting team.

Full Job Description
At Johnson & Johnson, we use technology and the power of teamwork to discover new ways to prevent and overcome the world’s the most significant healthcare challenges. Our Corporate, Consumer Health, Medical Devices, and Pharmaceutical teams leverage data, real-world insights, and creative minds to make life-changing healthcare products and medicines. We're disrupting outdated healthcare ecosystems and infusing them with transformative ideas to help people thrive throughout every stage of their lives. With a reach of more than a billion people every day, there’s no limit to the impact you can make here. Are you ready to reimagine healthcare?

Here, your career breakthroughs will change the future of health, in all the best ways. And you’ll change, too. You’ll be inspired, and you’ll inspire people across the world to change how they care for themselves and those they love. Amplify your impact. Join us!

Full Job Description
Addepar is looking for a talented product management intern to help us improve the product experience of our industry-leading client reporting suite.

Intern Program Dates: May 24 - Aug 13, 2021

As an intern, you will:
Learn about how reporting helps financial advisors and their clients, and how it relates to other areas of the larger Addepar ecosystem and wealth management industry
Develop understanding and empathy for our users' needs and pain points
Gather feedback and requirements from customers and stakeholders and translate them into data-driven product recommendations
Define product requirements, priorities, and milestones for new features/enhancements in collaboration with cross-functional teammates in design, engineering, and other orgs
Support the client reporting team's day-to-day operations, including helping with agile ceremonies, data aggregation, internal and external support, and bug triage

We are looking for:
A recent or soon-to-be college graduate with relevant education, work, or project experience in product management, information systems, computer science, or design
Excellent presentation, communication (listening, written, spoken), and influencing skills
A low ego and a high level of organization, accountability, and integrity
A servant leader mindset focused on facilitation, empathy, and consensus-building
A desire to "roll up your sleeves" and dive deeply into our users' most complex problems, even when faced with ambiguity and limited direction or support
Knowledge and experience with technical domains (SQL, software development, etc.), finance and financial data, and examples of personal projects are plusses

Addepar is a wealth management platform that specializes in data aggregation, analytics and reporting for even the most complex investment portfolios. Founded in 2009 by Joe Lonsdale, who currently serves as an active Chairman of its Board of Directors and General Partner at 8VC, the company's platform aggregates portfolio, market and client data all in one place. It provides asset owners and advisors a clearer financial picture at every level, allowing them to make more informed and timely investment decisions. Addepar works with hundreds of leading financial advisors, family offices and large financial institutions that manage data for over $2 trillion of assets on the company's platform. In 2020, Addepar was named as a Forbes Fintech 50 company and honored as a member of the CB Insights Fintech 250. Addepar is headquartered in Silicon Valley and has offices in New York City and Salt Lake City. All brokerage services offered through Acervus Securities Inc., member FINRA / SIPC.

Addepar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We seek to bring together diverse ideas, experiences, skill sets, perspectives, backgrounds, and identities to drive innovative solutions. We commit to promoting a welcoming environment where inclusion and belonging are held as a shared responsibility.

In order to ensure the health and safety of all Addepeeps and our prospective candidates, we have instituted a virtual interview and onboarding experience.

position: Internship - Product Manager, Credit Cards - Summer 2021
description:
Full Job Description
**Note: Unfortunately, Summer Internships at LendingTree are not open to students who will require sponsorship now or at any point in the future. Thank you.

This position will likely work remotely the entire summer. However, our preference is to hire someone who will be based in the Charlotte, NC area on the chance we're able to go back to office during the summer.

THE POSITION

Our former Summer Interns will tell you, LendingTree’s Internship Program is selective, challenging and structured to push the limits of what they thought they could do - and they wouldn’t have wanted it any other way. Are there easier ways to spend your summer? Absolutely. But a LendingTree Internship will help you grow professionally and also get you closer to landing a phenomenal job once you graduate – maybe even with LendingTree. Here’s what you can expect:

Real work. The only person you’ll be getting coffee for at LendingTree is yourself. You’ll be doing professional level work that will have a real impact on the business
Training. Sure you’ll learn a ton of industry skills as you contribute to your team every day, but you’ll also go through specific training on: crafting a phenomenal resume and LinkedIn profile, getting interviews and how to handle them, how to give a great presentation and more
You’re not alone. In addition from the support from your team you’ll be assigned a Mentor outside of your department who will guide you and mentor you throughout the summer
End of summer presentation. At the end of the summer every Intern gives a PPT presentation to Executives which will include a summary of what you accomplished, what you learned and 2 ideas that will either make the company money or save the company money

RESPONSIBILITIES

Own a project – Analyze current customer experiences. Define and run qualitative and quantitative customer research to inform the development of web-based products
Monitor and analyze product performance and communicate findings and recommendations for meaningful changes.
Define Product requirements for actionable changes and reiterate.
Put together wireframes to support product requirements and changes to be done.
Understand scope of the internal web-based product, participate in workshops. Own feature delivery, and write product requirements by working with business and development teams.
Communicate to partners on the progress of the feature/functionality.

QUALIFICATIONS

Undergrad or grad student (3.5+ GPA required) who will be graduating in Dec. 2021 or May 2022 (GPA must be listed on your resume to be considered).
Preferred majors: Business, Information Technology, Computer Science, Sociology, Psychology
Proficient in Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs, etc.) and SQL
Good understanding of customer research methods (qualitative, quantitative)
Knowledge of Agile/Scrum product development or software development methodologies is preferred.
Willingness to roll up your sleeves and GET STUFF DONE.

COMPANY

LendingTree is the nation’s largest online lending marketplace. That means we connect customers with multiple lenders so they find the best deals on loans, credit cards, savings accounts and insurance. Our goal is to help people save money, and we believe the best way to do that is by giving them a way to shop for loans and compare lenders so they make their best financial choices. Our CEO Doug Lebda founded the company in 1996 after a frustrating house-hunting experience. In those days, we mostly helped people find good mortgage deals. Now, we help consumers find their best in personal loans, auto loans, business loans, student loans, credit cards, savings accounts, home equity loans and more.

What else you should know:
We’re a publicly-traded company (TREE).
We’ve welcomed several other companies into the LendingTree family to augment our efforts at helping borrowers make their most sensible financial choices.
We’ve built the LendingTree app and My LendingTree dashboard to give consumers tools to manage and monitor their financial health.
We still make funny commercials.

CULTURE

We’re a fast-paced company with an entrepreneurial bend. We work hard and test our products often. We’re collaborative, ambitious, candid and high-energy. Our teammates are some of the brightest, most talented people you’ll ever work with. We care more about your smarts than we do about the kinds of clothes you wear (but please, do wear clothes to work!), and we’re pretty good about rewarding innovation, creativity and the knack for just getting stuff done (we even have an award for employees called the GSD, “Get Stuff Done”). Come work with us!

LendingTree is the kind of company that not only promotes diversity and inclusion; we thrive because of these values. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion (or creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation or military status.

Full Job Description
Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!

Role:
Splunk is looking for highly motivated college students to join our team. As an intern, you will work on a real project (or a few) and have an opportunity to enjoy our dynamic, startup-like environment.

You will experience Splunking and what defines our culture while honing the skills which separate our development teams from others. Working to support internal and external customer needs, you will collaborate with multi-functional teams, receive mentorship, and gain insight into our values-driven process. Our goal is both to support your growth and development while empowering you for a successful start to your career.

Responsibilities:
As a Software Engineer Intern you will be responsible for …

Building innovative solutions that enables rapid development. You will get to work with dedicated people who are doing state of the art development work (native mobile, front-end and back-end, DevOps) in areas of machine learning, data analytics, infrastructure and event correlations across silos to build outstanding business analytics software. You will be interacting with product management and customers to understand detailed requirements. You will also work with other engineering teams across Splunk to design and build high-performance solutions.

You will design, develop, code and test software systems, or applications for software improvements and new products
You'll actively contribute through participation in agile development of project timelines, implementation design specifications, system flow diagrams, documentation, testing, and ongoing support of systems
Your voice will have an impact through your recommended modifications to processes and procedures, and directly contribute to standard methodologies, architecture, and implementation

Requirements:
Possess knowledge of software engineering processes, tools (e.g.: programming proficiency in a language, preferably Go, Java, Python, etc), test development, algorithms and data structure.

Familiarity with object-oriented programming concepts, large-scale software architecture, networking and distributed systems, and UNIX/Linux environments
You have a good understanding of programming in one of the following programming languages including but not limited to: Go, Java, Python, Javascript
Familiarity with REST APIs and microservices is a plus
Familiarity with CI/CD concepts is a plus
Familiarity with tools and technologies like Git, Jenkins, Gitlab, AWS, Docker, GCP is a plus
Strong communication skills, verbal and written
You enjoy working well with others in a fast-paced environment
You enjoy working within an agile environment
You bring enthusiasm for solving interesting problems

Education:
Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics or a related technical field, and a strong record of academic achievement.

What We Offer You:
The opportunity to work with a set of extraordinarily talented and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering and QA to product management and customer support. Splunk flourishes with disruption and diversity.
A constant stream of new things for you to learn and an opportunity for growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation.
A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment

We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

Samsung has been on the cutting-edge of innovation for decades. We believe that technology can, and should, make the world a better place, so we create new connections for people everywhere. Join a team that is changing millions of lives.

Transforming smiles, changing lives

At Align Technology, we believe a great smile can transform a person’s life, so we create technology that gives people the confidence to take on whatever’s next. We revolutionized the orthodontic industry with the introduction of the Invisalign system, and we have never lost sight of that spirit of innovation. Our diverse and collaborative teams are constantly pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.

Ready to join us?

About this opportunity

Align is looking for a Software & Analytics R&D Intern for our San Jose, CA office for a full-time position for a minimum of 12 weeks. The Software & Analytics R&D Intern will be working with members of the Software and Product Analytics teams to develop, test and validate a user-interface tool that will allow querying Align’s digital clinical database and support the company’s product development activities and transform the orthodontic world with the Invisalign product. This is a unique opportunity with software development and data analytics combined into one project.

In this role, you will…

Build an end-to-end pipeline for a software application that converts user inputs to query data output
Develop a comprehensive understanding of the Invisalign products and database parameters
Transform user requirements to executable technical action items
Design a user-friendly interface application in C# or Java
Construct a back-end process to automatically covert user input to executable SQL queries
Optimize, review, validate and fix the codes
Work efficiently in a fast-paced environment and meet critical deadlines
Multi-task and prioritize requests to meet the most important and urgent business needs
Work independently and under supervision of Software & Product Analytics team members
Deliver a final presentation to be shared with all cross-functional teams

In this role, you’ll need …

To be a recent graduate or currently pursuing a MS or PhD degree in computer science, data science, statistics, business analytics or related technical field
Experience in software development (Strong object-oriented design skills)
Experience with SQL querying relational database
Experience in languages such as C#, Java or Python
Ability to learn quickly and absorb various techniques and knowledge

Sound like a good fit?

Align Technology is a publicly traded medical device company that is transforming smiles and changing lives. Our global team of talented employees develop innovative technology, tools and treatment options to help dental professionals worldwide achieve the clinical results they expect. Our digital ecosystem combines the power of technology to create beautiful smiles through the integration of AI and machine learning, digital imaging and visualization, biomechanics and material science to develop the Invisalign system, the most advanced clear aligner system in the world; iTero Intraoral Scanners and OrthoCAD digital services. Did you know? Align is the world’s largest manufacturer of custom 3D-printed materials.

By joining Align, you will be part of a global, fast-growing company in one of the most dynamic industries. Great people, innovative technologies, and meaningful work – these are just some of the things employees say make Align Technology a great place to work.

Full Job Description
LOCATION 2006 Route 130 North Burlington NJ US 08016

Overview

If you want hands on experience working in Information Technology (IT) for one of largest off-price retailers in the nation, join the nationally-ranked Burlington Stores, Inc. IT internship program! Are you a full-time student pursuing your Bachelor’s degree? Do you have at least a 3.0 GPA? Are you interested in a career as an IT professional? Are you a self-motivated, team player, with strong planning, organizational and communication skills? If so, this may be the right opportunity for you!

As an IT intern, you’ll work in one of our HQ Campus facilities located in Florence or Edgewater Park, NJ with the opportunity to explore our Infrastructure internship track. This won’t be your typical internship experience making copies and getting coffee!

Throughout the comprehensive 10-week summer program, you’ll be partnered with an experienced member of the IT team, who will serve as your “buddy” for support and guidance as you work in the fun and fast-paced world of IT in off-price retail! You will have the opportunity to work side by side with knowledgeable professionals, gaining practical knowledge, skills, and an understanding of IT’s role in supporting many of our company’s goals.

Throughout the summer, you will participate in Leadership Development Seminars, Classroom-style trainings in areas related to your program, tours of our stores and distribution centers, and community service projects – not to mention a variety of team-building social activities to help you get to know your intern class (including an Technology specific group project with your fellow IT Interns!)

Upon graduation, many alumni of our internship program go on to join our team as full-time associates, either rejoining the team where they completed their internship program or in a different branch of the organization! We are a rapidly growing brand, providing a variety of professional development opportunities so our associates can grow with us.

Infrastructure Track– IT Support Center and Tech Services rotation – As an infrastructure intern you will gain firsthand knowledge of the inner workings of what it takes to support IT Systems in a fast paced Retail business. Your time will be spent supporting our Stores, Distribution Centers, Corporate, and Field associates, rotating between our IT Support Center and Corporate Tech Services teams. Through these experiences you will also have exposure to various Networking, Security, Telecomm, and Systems support approaches. You will participate in the team meetings and have opportunities to shadow other IT technical areas that can help determine the direction of your professional career.

Our IT Support Center is a critical support component of our business, handling over 100,000 incidents a year. Working on our IT Support Center, you will work on the front lines of our support team as a Support Technician. Some of the experience you can expect to gain:

An understanding of basic troubleshooting techniques, managing situations, and customer interaction skills that could impact the productivity of systems and associates.
Leverage various knowledgebase and technical resources to solve technical problems remotely.
Contribute to projects, process improvements and be part of a great team environment!

Our Tech Services team offers face-to- face technical support to our associates in Corporate Offices and Distribution Centers. As a member of this team, you will have the opportunity to work throughout our campus locations with:
